    13                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 Kernel -dosbios- ('iosys6.s')
    14                                  ; Modified from 'iosys5.s' (28/12/2022, Retro DOS v4.1 Kernel's IO.SYS) file
    15                                  ; as below:
    16                                  ;    1) SYSINIT code has been changed from MSDOS 5.0 to MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
    17                                  ;      (except DOUBLESPACE feature! Retro DOS does not use the DOUBLESPACE.)	
    18                                  ;    2) 'iosys6.s' is same with 'iosys5.s' except sysinit code.
    19                                  ;	(Also, MSDOS 5.0 & MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS are almost same except
    20                                  ;	SYSINIT and 'Starting MS-DOS' msg part of MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS.) 
    21                                  
    22                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    23                                  
    24                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Multisection binary file format (BIOSDATA & BIOSCODE sections)
    25                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Erdogan Tan (Istanbul)
    26                                  
    27                                  ;Note: This code is a part of Retro DOS 4.0 kernel source code
    28                                  ;     (as included binary, 'IOSYS5.BIN') 
    29                                  ;     Equivalent of MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE and BIOSDATA and SYSINIT
    30                                  ;						        (except MSLOAD code)  
    31                                        
    32                                  ;---- Retro DOS v2 (v3) boot sector loads RETRODOS.SYS (MSDOS.SYS)
    33                                  ;     at 1000h:0000h and loader (initialization) part of RETRODOS kernel
    34                                  ;     moves IO.SYS (DOSBIOSCODE & DOSBIOSDATA, 'IOSYS5.BIN') to 70h:0000h.
    35                                  ;     Then SYSINIT code to the next segment (46Dh for original MSDOS 5.0)..
    36                                  ;     SYSINIT code relocates itself and DOSBIOSCODE and MSDOS.SYS
    37                                  ;     (MSDOS5.BIN) according to request/setting in 'config.sys' file.
    38                                  
    39                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    40                                  
    41                                  ;bpbx		struc ;	(sizeof=0x19)	
    42                                  ;
    43                                  ;bytespersec	dw ?			; base 10
    44                                  ;secperclust	db ?			; base 10
    45                                  ;rsvdsecs	dw ?			; base 10
    46                                  ;numfats	db ?			; base 10
    47                                  ;rootdirents	dw ?			; base 10
    48                                  ;totalsize16	dw ?			; base 10
    49                                  ;mediaid	db ?

    51                                  ;secpertrack	dw ?			; base 10
    52                                  ;heads		dw ?			; base 10
    53                                  ;hiddensecs_lw	dw ?			; base 10
    54                                  ;hiddensecs_hw	dw ?			; base 10
    55                                  ;totalsecs_lw	dw ?			; base 10
    56                                  ;totalsecs_hw	dw ?			; base 10
    57                                  ;
    58                                  ;bpbx		ends

   150                                  ;	  block of io.sys is, in fact, at cluster 2. This would be saving
   151                                  ;	  a whole lot of time during system debugging.
   152                                  ;
   153                                  ;============================================================================
   154                                  ;
   155                                  ;     for dos 4.00, msload program has been changed to allow:
   156                                  ;	  1. 32 bit calculation,
   157                                  ;	  2. reading a fat sector when needed, instead of reading the whole
   158                                  ;	     fat sectors at once. this will make the boot time faster,
   159                                  ;	     and eliminate the memory size limitation problem,
   160                                  ;	  3. solving the limitation of the file size (29 kb) of io.sys0,
   161                                  ;	  4. adding the boot error message. show the same boot error message
   162                                  ;	     and do the same behavior when the read operation of io.sys
   163                                  ;	     fails as the msboot program, since msload program is the
   164                                  ;	     extention of msboot program.

   259                                  ; SaveInputValues

   261                                  ; INPUT:     none
   262                                  ;
   263                                  ;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
   264                                  ;   ch = media byte
   265                                  ;   bx = first data sector (low) on disk (0-based)
   266                                  ;   ds:si = original rom bios diskette parameter table.
   267                                  ;
   268                                  ; if an extended boot record, then ax will be the first data sector
   269                                  ; high word. save ax and set FirstSectorH according to ax if it is an
   270                                  ; extended boot record.
   271                                  ;
   272                                  ;   ax = first data sector (high) on disk ;
   273                                  ; OUTPUT:
   274                                  ;
   275                                  ;   bx = first data sector on disk
   276                                  ;
   277                                  ;   MediaByte = input ch
   278                                  ;   BootDrive = input dl
   279                                  ;   FirstSectorL = input bx
   280                                  ;   FirstSectorH = input AX, if an extended boot record.;j.k.
   281                                  ;   TotalSectorsL = maximum sector number in this media ;j.k.
   282                                  ;   TotalSectorsH = high word of the above
   283                                  ;   HiddenSectorsL = hidden secotrs
   284                                  ;   HiddenSectorsH
   285                                  ;   ReservSectors = reserved sectors
   286                                  ;   SecPerTrack = sectors/track
   287                                  ;   NumHeads = heads/cylinder

   289                                  ;   ds = 0

   502                                  ; Relocate
   503                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   504                                  ;
   505                                  ; NOTES:
   506                                  ;
   507                                  ;   Relocates the loader code to top-of-memory.
   508                                  ;
   509                                  ; INPUT:     none
   510                                  ;
   511                                  ; OUTPUT:    code and data relocated.
   512                                  ;	     AX,CX,SI,DI destroyed
   513                                  ;
   514                                  ; calls:     none
   515                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   516                                  ;
   517                                  ; Determine the number of paragraphs (16 byte blocks) of memory.
   518                                  ; this involves invoking the memory size determination interrupt,
   519                                  ; which returns the number of 1k blocks of memory, and then
   520                                  ; converting this to the number of paragraphs.
   521                                  ; Find out whether RPL code is present at top of memory and modify the
   522                                  ; available amount of memory in AX
   523                                  ; leave the number of paragraphs of memory in ax.
   524                                  ;
   525                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   526                                  ; copy code from start to top of memory.
   527                                  ;
   528                                  ; the length to copy is EndOfLoader
   529                                  ;
   530                                  ; jump to relocated code
   531                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   532                                  
   533                                  		; 14/09/2023
   534                                  relocate:
   535                                  		; 24/12/2022
   536                                  		;cld
   537                                  
   538 000000C8 31F6                    		xor	si, si
   539                                  		; 14/09/2023
   540                                  		;mov	di, si
   541                                  		; di = 0
   542                                  
   543 000000CA CD12                    		int	12h		; MEMORY SIZE -
   544                                  					; Return: AX = number of contiguous 1K blocks of memory
   545 000000CC B106                    		mov	cl, 6
   546 000000CE D3E0                    		shl	ax, cl		; Memory size in paragraphs
   547                                  
   548                                  ;------ Check if an RPL program is present at TOM and do not tromp over it
   549                                  
   550                                  		; 10/12/2022
   551                                  		; ds = 0
   552                                  		; 24/12/2022
   553                                  		; ds = cs
   554                                  		;xor	bx, bx
   555                                  		;mov	ds, bx		; ZERO
   556                                  		; 14/09/2023

   558                                  		
   559                                  		;mov	bx, [DskAddr+44h] ; 2Fh*4 (Int 2Fh)
   560                                  		;mov	ds, [DskAddr+46h] ; 2Fh*4+2
   561                                  		; 10/12/2022

   563 000000D6 8E1EBE00                		mov	ds, [2Fh*4+2]		
   564

   568 000000DF 750F                    		jnz	short Skip_RPL

   570 000000E5 7509                    		jnz	short Skip_RPL

   572 000000E9 B8064A                  		mov	ax, 4A06h	; (multMULT shl	8) + multMULTRPLTOM

   575                                  Skip_RPL:
   576                                  		; 24/12/2022

   579

   581 000000F4 8B16[1200]              		mov	dx, [BytesPerSec] ; 24/12/2022
   582                                  		;mov	dx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
   583 000000F8 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl
   584 000000FA 42                      		inc	dx
   585 000000FB 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
   586 000000FD A3[3400]                		mov	[FatSegment], ax ; 24/12/2022
   587                                  		;mov	[cs:FatSegment], ax ; This will be used for fat sector
   588                                  		; 22/12/2022

   591                                  				; loader size + temporary/local stack space (*)
   592 00000103 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl
   593 00000105 42                      		inc	dx
   594 00000106 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
   595 00000108 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax	; ES:DI -> place be relocated.
   596                                  		; 22/12/2022
   597 0000010A 4A                      		dec	dx
   598 0000010B D3E2                    		shl	dx, cl	; convert paragraphs to bytes (*)	
   599                                  				; (stack pointer will be set to this offset)
   600                                  		; 24/12/2022

   643                                  ; FindClusterSize
   644                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   645                                  ;
   646                                  ; INPUT:     bpb information in loaded boot record at 0:7c00h
   647                                  ;
   648                                  ; OUTPUT:
   649                                  ;
   650                                  ;	ds = 0
   651                                  ;	ax = bytes/cluster
   652                                  ;	bx = sectors/cluster
   653                                  ;	si destroyed

   656                                  ;
   657                                  ; get bytes/sector from bpb
   658                                  ;

   683                                  ; CalcFatSize
   684                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   685                                  ;
   686                                  ; NOTES:
   687                                  ;
   688                                  ;   Determine if fat is 12 or 16 bit fat. 12 bit fat if floppy, read mbr
   689                                  ;   to find out what system id byte is.
   690                                  ;
   691                                  ; INPUT:
   692                                  ;

   694                                  ;

   696                                  ;   all other registers destroyed

   698                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   699                                  
   700                                  CalcFatSize:
   701                                  		; 14/09/2023

   710                                  		;;;

   760                                  ; ReadInFirstClusters
   761                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   762                                  ;
   763                                  ; NOTES: read the start of the clusters that covers at least IbmLoadSize
   764                                  ;	 fully.  for example, if sector/cluster = 2, and IbmLoadSize=3
   765                                  ;	 then we are going to re-read the second cluster to fully cover
   766                                  ;	 msload program in the cluster boundary.
   767                                  ;
   768                                  ; INPUT:
   769                                  ;   IbmLoadSize - make sure this value is the same as the one in
   770                                  ;		  msboot program when you build the new version!!!!!
   771                                  ;
   772                                  ;   SecPerCluster
   773                                  ;   ClusterSize
   774                                  ;   FirstSectorL
   775                                  ;   FirstSectorH
   776                                  ;
   777                                  ; OUTPUT: msload program is fully covered in a cluster boundary.
   778                                  ;	  ax = # of clusters we read in so far.
   779                                  ;
   780                                  ; calls:     ReadSectors
   781                                  ; logic:
   782                                  ;	ax; dx = IbmLoadSize / # of sector in a cluster.
   783                                  ;	if dx = 0 then ok. (msload is in a cluster boundary.)
   784                                  ;      else		   (has to read (ax+1)th cluster to cover msload)
   785                                  ;	read (ax+1)th cluster into the address after the clusters we
   786                                  ;	read in so far.
   787                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   788                                  
   789                                  ; 09/12/2022
   790                                  ; BiosStart equ 51Ah ; AX = IO.SYS starting cluster
   791                                  ; IbmLoadSize equ 3  ; AX = Number sectors in MSLOAD
   792                                  ; BiosOffset equ 700h ; Address where loader was read in
   793                                  	
   794                                  ReadInFirstClusters:
   795                                  		; 24/12/2022
   796                                  		;;mov	ax, [BioSStart]
   797                                  		;mov	ax, [51Ah]	; IO.SYS First Cluster
   798                                  		;dec	ax		; Root dir buffer at 500h (segment=0)
   799                                  		;			; IO.SYS first cluster ptr at 51Ah
   800                                  		;dec	ax		; AX = word [51Ah] - 2
   801                                  		;;mov	[cs:CurrentCluster], ax ;  Initialize to this cluster
   802                                  		; 24/12/2022
   803                                  		; ds = cs
   804                                  		;mov	[CurrentCluster], ax
   805                                  		; 24/12/2022
   806                                  		; [CurrentCluster] = word [51Ah] - 2
   807                                  
   808                                  		;mov	ax, IbmLoadSize
   809 00000164 B80300                  		mov	ax, 3		; Load the 3rd and other IO.SYS	sectors
   810 00000167 F6F1                    		div	cl ; *#*
   811                                  		;div	byte [SecPerCluster]
   812                                  		;;div	byte [cs:SecPerCluster]
   813                                  					; AL = total cluster read in
   814                                  					; AH = remaining sectors in last cluster
   815                                  		; 10/12/2022
   816 00000169 20E4                    		and	ah, ah
   817                                  		;cmp	ah, 0
   818 0000016B 7433                    		jz	short SetNextClusterNum	; next cluster
   819                                  
   820 0000016D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
   821 0000016F 50                      		push	ax		; AX = total clusters in the loader
   822                                  					; already read in
   823                                  ; 24/12/2022
   824                                  %if 0		
   825                                  		mov	cx, [cs:FirstSectorL] ;	Put starting sector of disk data
   826                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecL], cx    ; area in StartSecH:StartSecL
   827                                  		mov	cx, [cs:FirstSectorH]
   828                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecH], cx
   829                                  		mul	byte [cs:SecPerCluster]
   830                                  		add	[cs:StartSecL], ax ; Add number of sectors already loaded
   831                                  		adc	word [cs:StartSecH], 0 ; to start sector
   832                                  		;mov	ax, [BiosStart]
   833                                  		mov	ax, [51Ah] ; AX = [51Ah] = IO.SYS 1st clust
   834                                  		dec	ax
   835                                  		dec	ax
   836                                  		xor	bx, bx
   837                                  		mov	bl, [cs:SecPerCluster]
   838                                  		mul	bx		; DX:AX = logical start sector
   839                                  		add	[cs:StartSecL], ax
   840                                  		adc	[cs:StartSecH], dx
   841                                  					; abs start sector for next read of
   842                                  					; the rest of the last loader cluster

   845                                  		mul	word [cs:ClusterSize]
   846                                  		;mov	di, BiosOffset

   848                                  		add	di, ax

   851                                  		mov	al, [cs:SecPerCluster]
   852                                  					; Read in the entire last cluster
   853                                  		mov	[cs:SectorCount], ax
   854                                  		call	ReadSectors
   855                                  		pop	ax		; AX = total clust read	by boot	loader
   856                                  		inc	ax		; AX = total clust read	in now
   857                                  SetNextClusterNum:			; ...
   858                                  		inc	ax		; AX = total clusters read in based 2
   859                                  		add	[cs:CurrentCluster], ax
   860                                  		dec	ax		; CurrentCluster = Last	cluster	read
   861                                  					; AX = number of clusters loaded
   862                                  %endif
   863                                  		; 24/12/2022
   864                                  		; ds =cs
   865                                  		;mov	cx, [FirstSectorL] ; Put starting sector of disk data
   866                                  		;mov	[StartSecL], cx    ; area in StartSecH:StartSecL
   867                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:FirstSectorH]
   868                                  		;mov	[StartSecH], cx
   869                                  		; [StartSecL] = [FirstSectorL] ; **!**
   870                                  		; [StartSecH] = [FirstSectorH] ; **!**

   879

   881                                  		;dec	ax
   882                                  		;dec	ax

   884                                  		; ax = word [51Ah] - 2

   886                                  		;;xor	bx, bx

   889                                  		;mul	bx		; DX:AX = logical start sector
   890 0000017E F7E1                    		mul	cx  ; [SecPerCluster]  ; *#*
   891

   893 00000184 1116[0800]              		adc	[StartSecH], dx
   894                                  					; abs start sector for next read of
   895                                  					; the rest of the last loader cluster

   899                                  		;mov	di, BiosOffset

   901 00000191 01C7                    		add	di, ax

   903 00000195 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax		; ES = segment 0
   904                                  		; 24/12/2022

   909                                  		
   910 0000019B E86700                  		call	ReadSectors
   911 0000019E 58                      		pop	ax		; AX = total clust read	by boot	loader
   912 0000019F 40                      		inc	ax		; AX = total clust read	in now
   913                                  SetNextClusterNum:			; ...
   914 000001A0 40                      		inc	ax		; AX = total clusters read in based 2
   915 000001A1 0106[1000]              		add	[CurrentCluster], ax

   917                                  					; AX = number of clusters loaded
   918                                  		
   919                                  ; SaveLoadedBios
   920                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   921                                  ;
   922                                  ; NOTES:
   923                                  ;
   924                                  ;   Determine how much of iosys was loaded in when the loader was loaded
   925                                  ;   by the boot record (only the portion that is guaranteed to be contiguous)
   926                                  ;
   927                                  ; INPUT:
   928                                  ;   AX:Total cluster already read in (loader & bios)
   929                                  ;   CS:CurrentCluster = number of clusters used for loader+2
   930                                  ;
   931                                  ; OUTPUT:
   932                                  ;	ES = 70h
   933                                  ;	DI = next offset to load iosys code
   934                                  ;	AX,BX,CX,DX,SI destroyed
   935                                  ;
   936                                  ;	CS:NextBioLocation = di on output
   937                                  ;	CS:last_cluster = last cluster loaded
   938                                  ;
   939                                  ; calls:     none
   940                                  ;
   941                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   942                                  ;
   943                                  ; Multiply cluster * cluster size in bytes to get total loaded for msload
   944                                  ;
   945                                  ; Subtract total_loaded - (EndOfLoader) to get loaded io.sys in last cluster
   946                                  ;
   947                                  ; Relocate this piece of iosys down to 70:0
   948                                  ;
   949                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

   977                                  ; GetContigClusters
   978                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   979                                  ;
   980                                  ; NOTES: go find clusters as long as they are contiguous
   981                                  ;
   982                                  ;
   983                                  ; INPUT:
   984                                  ;   CS:NextBioLocation
   985                                  ;   CS:
   986                                  ;
   987                                  ; OUTPUT:
   988                                  ;
   989                                  ; calls: GetNextFatEntry
   990                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   991                                  ;
   992                                  ;Set CS:SectorCount to sectors per cluster
   993                                  ;
   994                                  ;Call GetNextFatEntry to get next cluster in file
   995                                  ;
   996                                  ;Call check_for_eof
   997                                  ;
   998                                  ;if (nc returned)
   999                                  ;
  1000                                  ;   {call GetNextFatEntry
  1001                                  ;
  1002                                  ;    if (new cluster is contig to old cluster)
  1003                                  ;	{add sectors per cluster to CS:SectorCount
  1004                                  ;
  1005                                  ;	 call check_for_eof
  1006                                  ;
  1007                                  ;	 if (nc returned)
  1008                                  ;
  1009                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1010                                  
  1011                                  ; 09/12/2022
  1012                                  ; END_OF_FILE equ 0FFh
  1013                                  ; DosLoadSeg equ 70h
  1014                                  
  1015                                  GetContigClusters:
  1016                                  
  1017                                  ; 24/12/2022
  1018                                  %if 0	
  1019                                  		xor	ah, ah
  1020                                  		mov	al, [cs:SecPerCluster]	; Assume we will get one cluster
  1021                                  		mov	[cs:SectorCount], ax	; Sector count = sectors in 1 cluster
  1022                                  		push	word [cs:SectorCount]
  1023                                  		call	GetNextFatEntry		; Returns next cluster to read in AX	
  1024                                  		pop	word [cs:SectorCount]
  1025                                  		mov	word [cs:CurrentCluster], ax ; Update the last one found
  1026                                  		cmp	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0FFh ; END_OF_FILE
  1027                                  		jz	short GoToBioInit
  1028                                  		xor	dx, dx
  1029                                  		;sub	ax, 2			; Zero base the cluster
  1030                                  		; 10/12/2022
  1031                                  		dec	ax
  1032                                  		dec	ax
  1033                                  		xor	ch, ch
  1034                                  		mov	cl, [cs:SecPerCluster]
  1035                                  		mul	cx			; How many sectors (before next cluster) 
  1036                                  		add	ax, [cs:FirstSectorL]	; See where the data sector starts
  1037                                  		adc	dx, [cs:FirstSectorH]
  1038                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecL], ax	; Save it (used by ReadSectors)
  1039                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecH], dx
  1040                                  		mov	di, [cs:NextBioLocation] ; Get where to put code
  1041                                  		push	word [cs:SectorCount]	; Save how many sectors
  1042                                  		;mov	ax, DosLoadSeg
  1043                                  		mov	ax, 70h
  1044                                  		mov	es, ax
  1045                                  		call	ReadSectors
  1046                                  		pop	ax			; Get back total sectors read in
  1047                                  		mul	word [cs:BytesPerSec]	; Get number of bytes we loaded
  1048                                  		add	[cs:NextBioLocation], ax ; Point to where to load next	
  1049                                  		jmp	short GetContigClusters
  1050                                  
  1051                                  %endif
  1052                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1053                                  		; ds = cs
  1054                                  
  1055 000001BF A1[1400]                		mov	ax, [SecPerCluster]	; Assume we will get one cluster
  1056 000001C2 A3[0E00]                		mov	[SectorCount], ax	; Sector count = sectors in 1 cluster
  1057                                  		;push	word [SectorCount]
  1058 000001C5 50                      		push	ax
  1059 000001C6 E8B900                  		call	GetNextFatEntry		; Returns next cluster to read in AX	
  1060 000001C9 8F06[0E00]              		pop	word [SectorCount]
  1061 000001CD A3[1000]                		mov	[CurrentCluster], ax	; Update the last one found
  1062                                  
  1063 000001D0 803E[2B00]FF            		cmp	byte [EndOfFile], 0FFh	; END_OF_FILE
  1064 000001D5 741A                    		je	short GoToBioInit ; 23/12/2022
  1065                                  		; 22/12/2022

  1069 000001D7 48                      		dec	ax
  1070 000001D8 48                      		dec	ax

  1073                                  		;mov	cx, [SecPerCluster]

  1075 000001D9 F726[1400]              		mul	word [SecPerCluster]
  1076 000001DD 0306[2400]              		add	ax, [FirstSectorL]	; See where the data sector starts
  1077 000001E1 1316[2600]              		adc	dx, [FirstSectorH]
  1078 000001E5 A3[0600]                		mov	[StartSecL], ax		; Save it (used by ReadSectors)
  1079 000001E8 8916[0800]              		mov	[StartSecH], dx
  1080

  1082

  1084                                  				; ES:DI = (the next) buffer address for next read
  1085                                  		
  1086 000001EF EBCE                    		jmp	short GetContigClusters

  1088                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1089                                  
  1090                                  ; GoToBiosInit
  1091                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1092                                  ;
  1093                                  ; NOTES:
  1094                                  ;
  1095                                  ;  Set up required registers for iosys, then jump to it (70:0)
  1096                                  ;
  1097                                  ; INPUT:     none
  1098                                  ;
  1099                                  ;   CS:MediaByte = media byte
  1100                                  ;   CS:BootDrive = int 13 drive number we booted from
  1101                                  ;   CS:FirstSectorL = first data sector on disk (low) (0-based)
  1102                                  ;   CS:FirstSectorH = first data sector on disk (high)
  1103                                  ;
  1104                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1105                                  ;
  1106                                  ;   required by msinit
  1107                                  ;   DL = int 13 drive number we booted from
  1108                                  ;   CH = media byte
  1109                                  ;   BX = first data sector on disk (0-based)
  1110                                  ;   AX = first data sector on disk (high)
  1111                                  ;   DI = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  1112                                  ;
  1113                                  ; calls:     none
  1114                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1115                                  ;
  1116                                  ; set up registers for msinit then do far jmp
  1117                                  ;
  1118                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1119                                  
  1120                                  GoToBioInit:	
  1121                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1122                                  		; ds = cs	
  1123                                  		;mov	ch, [cs:MediaByte]
  1124                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:BootDrive]
  1125                                  		;mov	bx, [cs:FirstSectorL]
  1126                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:FirstSectorH]
  1127                                  
  1128 000001F1 8A2E[2A00]              		mov	ch, [MediaByte] ; Restore regs required for msint
  1129 000001F5 8A16[2800]              		mov	dl, [BootDrive] ; Physical drv number we booted from.
  1130 000001F9 8B1E[2400]              		mov	bx, [FirstSectorL] ; AX:BX = first data sector of disk
  1131 000001FD A1[2600]                		mov	ax, [FirstSectorH]
  1132                                  
  1133 00000200 EA00007000              		jmp	70h:0	; Far jump to IoSysAddr	(DOSBIOS)
  1134                                  
  1135                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1136                                  
  1137                                  ; ReadSectors
  1138                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1139                                  ; notES:
  1140                                  ;
  1141                                  ;  read in the CS:SectorCount number of sectors at ES:di
  1142                                  ;
  1143                                  ;
  1144                                  ; INPUT:
  1145                                  ;
  1146                                  ;   DI = OFFSET of start of read
  1147                                  ;   ES = segment of read
  1148                                  ;   CS:SectorCount = number of sectors to read
  1149                                  ;   CS:StartSecL = starting sector (low)
  1150                                  ;   CS:StartSecH = starting sector (high)
  1151                                  ;   following is bpb info that must be setup prior to call
  1152                                  ;   CS:NumHeads
  1153                                  ;   CS:number_of_sectors
  1154                                  ;   CS:BootDrive
  1155                                  ;   CS:SecPerTrack
  1156                                  ;
  1157                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1158                                  ;
  1159                                  ;   AX,BX,CX,DX,SI,DI destroyed
  1160                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1161                                  ; divide start sector by sectors per track
  1162                                  ; the remainder is the actual sector number, 0 based
  1163                                  ;
  1164                                  ; increment actual sector number to get 1 based
  1165                                  ;
  1166                                  ; the quotient is the number of tracks - divide by heads to get the cyl
  1167                                  ;
  1168                                  ; the remainder is actual head, the quotient is cylinder
  1169                                  ;
  1170                                  ; figure the number of sectors in that track, set al to this
  1171                                  ;
  1172                                  ; do the read
  1173                                  ;
  1174                                  ; if error, do reset, then redo the int 13h
  1175                                  ;
  1176                                  ; if successful read, subtract # sectors read from SectorCount, add to logical
  1177                                  ; sector, add #sectors read * BytesPerSec to bx;
  1178                                  ;
  1179                                  ; if SectorCount <> 0 do next read
  1180                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1181                                  
  1182                                  ReadSectors:
  1183                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1184                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1185                                  ReadSectors:
  1186 00000205 B90500                  		mov	cx, 5			; 5 retries
  1187

  1189                                  		; logical sector number

  1227                                  		;;mov	si, [cs:SectorCount]	; Yes, only read what we need to
  1228                                  ;GotLength:
  1229                                  
  1230                                  		; 24/12/2022

  1232                                  		; 700h+0F8FFh < 64KB address 
  1233                                  		;	(there is not an override risk up to 63743 bytes)
  1234                                  ; 24/12/2022
  1235                                  %if 0
  1236                                  		; 24/12/2022

  1238                                  		; Also, Segment Override risk !
  1239                                  		or	di, di
  1240                                  		jz	short dma_boundary_ok ; no problem for the 1st read
  1241                                  		;cmp	byte [BootDrive], 80h
  1242                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:BootDrive], 80h
  1243                                  		;jnb	short dma_boundary_ok ; no problem for hard disks
  1244                                  dma_boundary_chk:
  1245                                  		cmp	si, 1
  1246                                  		jna	short dma_boundary_ok 
  1247                                  				; 1 sector read will not cause a boundary error			
  1248                                  		push	dx
  1249                                  		push	ax
  1250                                  		mov	ax, si
  1251                                  		sub	dx, dx
  1252                                  		mul	word [BytesPerSec]
  1253                                  		mov	bx, es
  1254                                  		mov	cl, 4
  1255                                  		shl	bx, cl	; convert paragraphs to bytes
  1256                                  		; bx = segment start position (for 64K memory sections)
  1257                                  		add	bx, ax	; byte count to read
  1258                                  		pop	ax
  1259                                  		pop	dx

  1261                                  		jnc	short dma_boundary_ok
  1262

  1264                                  		; DMA boundary error or segment override risk!
  1265                                  		dec	si
  1266                                  		jmp	short dma_boundary_chk

  1268                                  %endif
  1269                                  		; 24/12/2022

  1272                                  		; 18/12/2022

  1285                                  		;;mov	[cs:TempH], ax

  1289

  1291                                  			; ax <= 1024, dx <= 255

  1297 00000248 08DC                    		or	ah, bl			; Mix in with sector bits

  1300 0000024E 89FB                    		mov	bx, di			; Get back OFFSET

  1401                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1402                                  
  1403                                  ; GetNextFatEntry
  1404                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1405                                  ;
  1406                                  ; NOTES:
  1407                                  ;
  1408                                  ;   given the last cluster found, this will return the next cluster of
  1409                                  ;   iosys. if the last cluster is (f)ff8 - (f)fff, then the final cluster
  1410                                  ;   of iosys has been loaded, and control is passed to goto_iosys
  1411                                  ;   msload can handle maximum fat area size of 128 kb.
  1412                                  ;
  1413                                  ; INPUT:
  1414                                  ;
  1415                                  ;    CS:CurrentCluster
  1416                                  ;    CS:FatSize
  1417                                  ;
  1418                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1419                                  ;
  1420                                  ;   CS:CurrentCluster (updated)
  1421                                  ;
  1422                                  ; calls:  GetFatSector
  1423                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1424                                  ; get CurrentCluster
  1425                                  ;
  1426                                  ; if (16 bit fat)
  1427                                  ;    {if (CurrentCluster = fff8 - ffff)
  1428                                  ;	 {jmp goto_iosys}
  1429                                  ;     else
  1430                                  ;	{get OFFSET by multiply cluster by 2}
  1431                                  ;
  1432                                  ; else
  1433                                  ;    {if (CurrentCluster = ff8 - fff)
  1434                                  ;	 {jmp goto_iosys}
  1435                                  ;     else
  1436                                  ;	{get OFFSET by	- multiply cluster by 3
  1437                                  ;
  1438                                  ;	 rotate right to divide by 2
  1439                                  ;
  1440                                  ;	 if (cy set - means odd number)
  1441                                  ;	    {shr 4 times to keep high twelve bits}
  1442                                  ;
  1443                                  ;	 else
  1444                                  ;	    {and with 0fffh to keep low 12 bits}
  1445                                  ;	}
  1446                                  ;    }
  1447                                  ;
  1448                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1449                                  
  1450                                  ; 09/12/2022
  1451                                  ; FAT_12_BIT equ 1
  1452                                  ; NOT_END_OF_FILE equ 0  ; ~END_OF_FILE ; END_OF_FILE equ 0FFh
  1453                                  
  1454                                  GetNextFatEntry:
  1455 00000282 06                      		push	es
  1456                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1457                                  		; ds = cs
  1458                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:FatSegment]
  1459 00000283 A1[3400]                		mov	ax, [FatSegment]
  1460 00000286 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax		; ES-> FAT area segment
  1461                                  		; 09/12/2022
  1462                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], END_OF_FILE
  1463                                  		;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0FFh ; Assume last cluster
  1464                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:CurrentCluster] ; Get last cluster
  1465                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1466                                  		; ds = cs
  1467 00000288 C606[2B00]FF            		mov	byte [EndOfFile], 0FFh ; Assume last cluster
  1468 0000028D A1[1000]                		mov	ax, [CurrentCluster] ; Get last cluster
  1469 00000290 803E[2900]01            		cmp	byte [Fatsize], 1
  1470                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:FatSize], FAT_12_BIT
  1471                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:Fatsize], 1
  1472 00000295 7537                    		jne	short Got16Bit	; 23/12/2022
  1473 00000297 89C6                    		mov	si, ax
  1474 00000299 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  1475 0000029B 01C6                    		add	si, ax		; SI = AX * 1.5 = AX + AX/2
  1476                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1477                                  		;push	dx
  1478                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  1479 0000029D 29D2                    		sub	dx, dx ; 23/12/2022
  1480 0000029F E84700                  		call	GetFatSector
  1481                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1482                                  		;pop	dx
  1483 000002A2 7510                    		jnz	short ClusterOk
  1484 000002A4 268A07                  		mov	al, [es:bx]
  1485                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1486                                  		;mov	[cs:TempCluster], al
  1487                                  		;push	ax ; (*)
  1488 000002A7 46                      		inc	si
  1489                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1490                                  		;push	dx
  1491 000002A8 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  1492 000002AA E83C00                  		call	GetFatSector	; Read next fat sector
  1493                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1494                                  		;pop	dx
  1495                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1496                                  		;mov	al, [es:0]
  1497                                  		;mov	[cs:TempCluster+1], al
  1498                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:TempCluster]
  1499                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1500                                  		;pop	ax ; (*) 
  1501 000002AD 268A260000              		mov	ah, [es:0]
  1502 000002B2 EB03                    		jmp	short EvenOdd
  1503                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1504                                  
  1505                                  ClusterOk:				
  1506 000002B4 268B07                  		mov	ax, [es:bx]
  1507                                  EvenOdd:	
  1508                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1509                                  		; ds = cs
  1510 000002B7 F606[1000]01            		test	byte [CurrentCluster], 1
  1511                                  		; 10/12/2022		
  1512                                  		;test	byte [cs:CurrentCluster], 1 ; 09/12/2022
  1513                                  		;;test	word [cs:CurrentCluster], 1 ; Was last cluster odd?
  1514 000002BC 7505                    		jnz	short OddResult		; If not zero it was odd
  1515 000002BE 25FF0F                  		and	ax, 0FFFh		; Keep low 12 bits
  1516 000002C1 EB04                    		jmp	short TestEOF
  1517                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1518                                  
  1519                                  OddResult:				
  1520 000002C3 B104                    		mov	cl, 4			; Keep high 12 bits for odd
  1521 000002C5 D3E8                    		shr	ax, cl
  1522                                  TestEOF:				
  1523 000002C7 3DF80F                  		cmp	ax, 0FF8h		; Is it last cluster?
  1524 000002CA 731B                    		jnb	short GotClusterDone	; Yep, all done here
  1525 000002CC EB14                    		jmp	short NotLastCluster
  1526                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1527                                  
  1528                                  Got16Bit:
  1529                                  		; 23/12/2022				
  1530                                  		;push	dx
  1531                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  1532 000002CE 29D2                    		sub	dx, dx ; 23/12/2022
  1533 000002D0 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1			; Multiply cluster by 2
  1534 000002D2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  1535 000002D5 89C6                    		mov	si, ax			; Get the final buffer OFFSET
  1536 000002D7 E80F00                  		call	GetFatSector
  1537                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1538                                  		;pop	dx
  1539 000002DA 268B07                  		mov	ax, [es:bx]
  1540 000002DD 83F8F8                  		cmp	ax, 0FFF8h
  1541 000002E0 7305                    		jnb	short GotClusterDone
  1542                                  NotLastCluster:	
  1543                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1544                                  		; ds = cs			
  1545                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], NOT_END_OF_FILE ; ~END_OF_FILE
  1546                                  		;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0	; Assume not last cluster
  1547 000002E2 C606[2B00]00            		mov	byte [EndOfFile], 0	; Assume not last cluster
  1548                                  GotClusterDone:				
  1549 000002E7 07                      		pop	es
  1550                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1551                                  EndRead:
  1552 000002E8 C3                      		retn
  1553                                  
  1554                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1555                                  
  1556                                  ; GetFatSector
  1557                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1558                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ES:0
  1559                                  ;
  1560                                  ;in). SI = offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find.
  1561                                  ;     ES = fat sector segment
  1562                                  ;     CS:BytesPerSec
  1563                                  ;
  1564                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  1565                                  ;      BX = offset value of the corresponding fat entry in the fat sector.
  1566                                  ;      CX destroyed.
  1567                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e. when 12 bit fat entry
  1568                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  1569                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  1570                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat).
  1571                                  ;
  1572                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1573                                  
  1574                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1575                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1576                                  GetFatSector:
  1577 000002E9 50                      		push	ax
  1578 000002EA 56                      		push	si
  1579 000002EB 57                      		push	di
  1580 000002EC 89F0                    		mov	ax, si
  1581                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1582                                  		; ds = cs
  1583                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
  1584                                  		;div	cx			; AX = Sector number, DX = Offset
  1585 000002EE F736[1200]              		div	word [BytesPerSec]
  1586 000002F2 3B06[0C00]              		cmp	ax, [LastFatSector]
  1587                                  		;cmp	ax, [cs:LastFatSector]	; The same fat sector?
  1588 000002F6 7421                    		je	short SplitChk		; Don't need to read it again.
  1589 000002F8 A3[0C00]                		mov	[LastFatSector], ax
  1590                                  		;mov	[cs:LastFatSector], ax
  1591 000002FB 52                      		push	dx
  1592                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1593 000002FC 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  1594                                  		;add	ax, [cs:HiddenSectorsL]
  1595                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:HiddenSectorsH]
  1596                                  		;add	ax, [cs:ReservSectors]
  1597                                  		;adc	dx, 0
  1598                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1599                                  		; ds = cs
  1600 000002FE 0306[3000]              		add	ax, [FatStartSecL]
  1601 00000302 1316[3200]              		adc	dx, [FatStartSecH]
  1602 00000306 A3[0600]                		mov	[StartSecL], ax
  1603 00000309 8916[0800]              		mov	[StartSecH], dx		; Set up for ReadSectors
  1604                                  		;mov	[cs:StartSecL], ax
  1605                                  		;mov	[cs:StartSecH], dx	; Set up for ReadSectors
  1606                                  		
  1607 0000030D C706[0E00]0100          		mov	word [SectorCount], 1 ; 1 sector			
  1608                                  		;mov	word [cs:SectorCount], 1 ; 1 sector
  1609 00000313 31FF                    		xor	di, di ; 0
  1610                                  		; es:di = FATSEGMENT:0000h
  1611 00000315 E8EDFE                  		call	ReadSectors
  1612 00000318 5A                      		pop	dx
  1613                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1614                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
  1615                                  SplitChk:
  1616                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1617 00000319 8B0E[1200]              		mov	cx, [BytesPerSec]				
  1618 0000031D 49                      		dec	cx			; CX = SECTOR SIZE - 1
  1619 0000031E 39CA                    		cmp	dx, cx			; If last byte of sector, splitted entry.
  1620 00000320 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx			; set bx to dx
  1621 00000322 5F                      		pop	di
  1622 00000323 5E                      		pop	si
  1623 00000324 58                      		pop	ax
  1624                                  EndWrite:		; 10/12/2022
  1625 00000325 C3                      		retn
  1626                                  
  1627                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1628                                  
  1629                                  ErrorOut:
  1630                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1631                                  		; ds = cs
  1632                                  		;push	cs
  1633                                  		;pop	ds
  1634                                  		
  1635 00000326 BE[4D03]                		mov	si, NonSystemDiskMsg ; "\r\nNon-System disk or disk error\r\nRe"...
  1636 00000329 E81400                  		call	WriteTTY
  1637                                  
  1638                                  		; Wait for a keypress on the keyboard.
  1639                                  		; Use the bios keyboard interrupt.
  1640                                  
  1641 0000032C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  1642 0000032E CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
  1643                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
  1644                                  
  1645                                  		; We have to restore the address of the original rom disk
  1646                                  		; parameter table to the location at [0:DskAddr]. The address
  1647                                  		; of this original table has been saved previously in
  1648                                  		; 0:OrgDasdPtr and 0:OrgDasdPtr+2. After this table address
  1649                                  		; has been restored we can reboot by invoking the bootstrap
  1650                                  		; loader bios interrupt.
  1651                                  
  1652                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1653                                  		;xor	bx, bx
  1654                                  		;mov	ds, bx
  1655                                  		;les	bx, [OrgDasdPtr] ; Wrong DS segment !
  1656                                  					 ; (Erdogan Tan, 23/12/2022)
  1657 00000330 C41E[2C00]              		les	bx, [OrgDasdPtr] ; Correct DS segment = CS
  1658                                  		
  1659                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1660 00000334 16                      		push	ss ; 0
  1661 00000335 1F                      		pop	ds
  1662                                  		; ds = 0		
  1663                                  
  1664 00000336 BE7800                  		mov	si, DskAddr	; (Int 1Eh)
  1665 00000339 891C                    		mov	[si], bx	; restore offset		
  1666 0000033B 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; restore segment
  1667 0000033E CD19                    		int	19h		; reboot
  1668                                  
  1669                                  
  1670                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1671                                  
  1672                                  ; WriteTTY
  1673                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1674                                  ; in) DS:si -> asciiz string.
  1675                                  ;
  1676                                  ; WriteTTY the character in al to the screen.
  1677                                  ; use video service 'write teletype to active page' (ROM_TTY)
  1678                                  ; use normal character attribute
  1679                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1680                                  
  1681                                  WriteTTY:
  1682 00000340 AC                      		lodsb
  1683 00000341 08C0                    		or	al, al
  1684 00000343 74E0                    		jz	short EndWrite
  1685                                  		;mov	AH, ROM_TTY	; 09/12/2022
  1686 00000345 B40E                    		mov	ah, 0Eh
  1687 00000347 B307                    		mov	bl, 7		; "normal" attribute
  1688 00000349 CD10                    		int	10h		; - VIDEO - WRITE CHARACTER AND	ADVANCE	CURSOR (TTY WRITE)
  1689                                  					; AL = character, BH = display page (alpha modes)
  1690                                  					; BL = foreground color	(graphics modes)
  1691 0000034B EBF3                    		jmp	short WriteTTY
  1692                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1693                                  
  1694                                  ; 10/12/2022	
  1695                                  ;EndWrite:
  1696                                  ;		retn

  1736 00000003 0000                    DosDataSg:	dw 0
  1737                                  
  1738                                  ; DOS's int 2f handler will exit via a jump through here.
  1739                                  ; This is how the BIOS hooks int2f

  1741                                  ;BIOSDATA:0005h: ; 10/05/2023 (Note the 'bios_i2f equ 5' in 'msdos6.s')
  1742                                  			
  1743 00000005 EA                      bios_i2f:	db 0EAh			; far jump to int_2f (segment may not be at 70h)
  1744                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  1745                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIODATA:0006h
  1746                                  		;dw int_2f
  1747                                  		;dw 70h			; BIOSDATA segment (KERNEL_SEGMENT)
  1748 00000006 [4313]                  		dw i2f_handler	
  1749                                  bios_i2f_seg:	; 10/08/2023
  1750 00000008 9D02                    		dw DOSBIOCODESEG	; 02CCh for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS (25Ch+070h)

  1752                                  
  1753 0000000A 0000                    romstartaddr:	dw 0			; The start address for the romfind routines
  1754                                  					; This is to maintain binary compatibility
  1755                                  					; with DISK based DOS 5.0
  1756                                  
  1757                                  ; This is a byte used for special key handling in the resident
  1758                                  ; console device driver. It must be here so that it can be included
  1759                                  ; in the WIN386 instance table (in INC\LMSTUB.ASM).

  1770                                  ; puts the address of the Request header in this variable and returns.

  1907 00000119 [4E03]                  start_bds:	dw bds1			; Start	of linked list of BDS's
  1908 0000011B 7000                    		dw 70h			; KERNEL_SEGMENT
  1909                                  
  1910                                  ; (MSDOS 3.3) NOTE:
  1911                                  ; Some floppy drives do not have changeline support. The result is a
  1912                                  ; large amount of inefficiency in the code. A media-check always returns
  1913                                  ; "I don`t know". This cause DOS to reread the FAT on every access and
  1914                                  ; always discard any cached data.
  1915                                  ;    We get around this inefficiency by implementing a "Logical Door Latch".
  1916                                  ; The following three items are used to do this. The logical door latch is
  1917                                  ; based on the premise that it is not physically possible to change floppy
  1918                                  ; disks in a drive in under two seconds (most people take about 10). The
  1919                                  ; logical door latch is implemented by saving the time of the last successful
  1920                                  ; disk operation (in the value TIM_DRV). When a new request is made the
  1921                                  ; current time is compared to the saved time. If less than two seconds have
  1922                                  ; passed then the value "No Change" is returned. If more than two seconds
  1923                                  ; have passed the value "Don't Know" is returned.
  1924                                  ;    There is one complecation to this algorithm. Some programs change the
  1925                                  ; value of the timer. In this unfortunate case we have an invalid timer.
  1926                                  ; This possibility is detected by counting the number of disk operations
  1927                                  ; which occur without any time passing. If this count exceeds the value of
  1928                                  ; "AccessMax" we assume the counter is invalid and always return "Don't
  1929                                  ; Know". The variable "AccessCount" is used to keep track of the number
  1930                                  ; of disk operation which occur without the time changing.
  1931                                  
  1932 0000011D 00                      accesscount:	db 0			
  1933 0000011E FF                      tim_drv:	db 0FFh			
  1934 0000011F 00                      medbyt:		db 0
  1935                                  wrtverify:	; 15/10/2022			
  1936 00000120 02                      rflag:		db 2			; 2 for	read, 3	for write
  1937 00000121 00                      verify:		db 0			; 1 if verify after write
  1938 00000122 0000                    seccnt:		dw 0			
  1939 00000124 00                      		db 0			; -- pad where hardnum was
  1940 00000125 01                      dsktnum:	db 1			; number of diskette drives			
  1941                                  
  1942                                  ; (MSDOS 3.3) NOTE:
  1943                                  ; Some of the older versions of the IBM rom-bios always assumed a seek would
  1944                                  ; have to be made to read the diskette. Consequently a large head settle
  1945                                  ; time was always used in the I/O operations. To get around this problem
  1946                                  ; we need to continually adjust the head settle time. The following
  1947                                  ; algorithm is used:
  1948                                  ;
  1949                                  ;   Get the current head settle value.
  1950                                  ;   If it is 1, then
  1951                                  ;	set slow = 15
  1952                                  ;   else
  1953                                  ;	set slow = value
  1954                                  ;   ...
  1955                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing then
  1956                                  ;	use slow
  1957                                  ;   else
  1958                                  ;	use fast
  1959                                  ;   ...
  1960                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  1961                                  
  1962 00000126 00                      motorstartup:	db 0			; value from table
  1963 00000127 00                      settlecurrent:	db 0			; value	from table
  1964 00000128 00                      settleslow:	db 0			; slow settle value
  1965 00000129 00                      nextspeed:	db 0			; value	of speed to be used
  1966 0000012A 00                      save_head_sttl:	db 0			; used by read_sector routine
  1967 0000012B 00                      save_eot:	db 0			; saved	eot from the default DPT
  1968 0000012C 09                      eot:		db 9			
  1969 0000012D 00000000                dpt:		dd 0			; pointer to Disk Parameter Table			
  1970 00000131 00                      cursec:		db 0			; current sector
  1971 00000132 00                      curhd:		db 0			; current head
  1972 00000133 0000                    curtrk:		dw 0			; current track
  1973 00000135 0000                    spsav:		dw 0			; save the stack pointer
  1974 00000137 08                      formt_eot:	db 8			; eot used for format
  1975 00000138 00                      hdnum:		db 0			; head number
  1976 00000139 0000                    trknum:		dw 0			; track	being manipulated
  1977 0000013B 50                      gap_patch:	db 50h			; format gap patched into dpt
  1978

  2014                                  ; on floppy reads to odd-byte boundaries. Although no general effort 
  2015                                  ; is made to enforce this in the bigger picture, this one small sacrifice

  2407                                  ;************************************************************************
  2408                                  ;*									*
  2409                                  ;*	strategy - store es:bx (device driver request packet)		*
  2410                                  ;*		     away at [ptrsav] for next driver function call	*
  2411                                  ;*									*
  2412                                  ;************************************************************************
  2413                                  
  2414                                  strategy:	; proc far		
  2415 000006D0 2E891E[1200]            		mov	[cs:ptrsav], bx ; store es:bx (device driver request packet)
  2416                                  					; away at [ptrsav] for next driver function call
  2417 000006D5 2E8C06[1400]            		mov	[cs:ptrsav+2], es
  2418 000006DA CB                      		retf

  2420                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2421                                  
  2422                                  ;************************************************************************
  2423                                  ;*									*
  2424                                  ;*	device driver entry points. these are the initial		*
  2425                                  ;*	  'interrupt' hooks out of the device driver chain.		*
  2426                                  ;*	  in the case of our resident drivers, they'll just		*
  2427                                  ;*	  stick a fake return address on the stack which		*
  2428                                  ;*	  points to dispatch tables and possibly some unit		*
  2429                                  ;*	  numbers, and then call through a common entry point		*
  2430                                  ;*	  which can take care of a20 switching				*
  2431                                  ;*									*
  2432                                  ;************************************************************************
  2433                                  
  2434                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Erdogan Tan
  2435                                  ; (disassembled MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS code here with fixed table
  2436                                  ;  addresses, they will be changed to table labels later)
  2437                                  
  2438                                  ; 09/12/2022
  2439                                  
  2440                                  con_entry:				
  2441 000006DB E84000                  		call	cdev_entry
  2442                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2443                                  		;dw 0E4h		; con_table
  2444 000006DE [E700]                  		dw con_table	
  2445                                  					; 2C7h:0E4h = 70h:2654h
  2446                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2447                                  
  2448                                  prn0_entry:

  2450                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2451                                  		;dw 0FBh		; prn_table
  2452 000006E3 [FE00]                  		dw prn_table
  2453                                  					; 2C7h:0FBh = 70h:266Bh
  2454 000006E5 0000                    		db 0, 0
  2455                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2456                                  
  2457                                  prn1_entry:

  2459                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2460                                  		;dw 0FBh		; prn_table

  2463 000006EC 0001                    		db 0, 1
