  4417                                  
  4418                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4419                                  BPB48T:
  4420                                  ;bpb48t:	; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 112, 720, 0FDh, 2, 9, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4421                                  		; 48 tpi diskettes	;
  4422                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4423                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4424                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4425                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4426                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4427                                  		dw	720 ; 2*9*40	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4428                                  		db	0FDh		; media descriptor
  4429                                  		dw	2		; number of fat sectors
  4430                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4431                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4432                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4433                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4434                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4435                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)					
  4436                                  
  4437                                  		db 90h
  4438                                  ;align 2
  4439                                  BPB96T:
  4440                                  ;bpb96t:	; bpbx <512, 1, 1, 2, 224, 2400, 0F9h, 7, 15, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4441                                  		; 96 tpi diskettes	;
  4442                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4443                                  		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4444                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4445                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4446                                  		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4447                                  		dw	2400 ; 2*15*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4448                                  		db	0F9h		; media descriptor
  4449                                  		dw	7		; number of fat sectors
  4450                                  		dw	15		; sectors per track
  4451                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4452                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4453                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4454                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4455                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4456                                  
  4457                                  		db 90h
  4458                                  ;align 2
  4459                                  BPB35:

  4461                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 720 KB ;		
  4462                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4463                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4464                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4465                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4466                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4467                                  		dw	1440 ; 2*9*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4468                                  		db	0F9h		; media descriptor
  4469                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors
  4470                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4471                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4472                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4473                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4474                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4475                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4476                                  
  4477                                  		db 90h
  4478                                  ;align 2
  4479                                  
  4480                                  ;align 2
  4481                                  ;BPB144:
  4482                                  ;bpb144:	; Retro DOS v4.0 feature only !	; 1.44MB diskettes
  4483                                  ;
  4484                                  ;		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4485                                  ;		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4486                                  ;		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4487                                  ;		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4488                                  ;		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4489                                  ;		dw	2880 ; 2*18*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4490                                  ;		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4491                                  ;		dw	9		; number of fat sectors
  4492                                  ;		dw	18		; sectors per track
  4493                                  ;		dw	2		; heads
  4494                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4495                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4496                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4497                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4498                                  ;
  4499                                  ;		db 90h
  4500                                  ;align 2
  4501                                  
  4502                                  BPB288:
  4503                                  ;bpb288:	; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 240, 5760, 0F0h, 9, 36, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0>
  4504                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 2.88 MB ;	 
  4505                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4506                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4507                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4508                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4509                                  		dw	240		; number of directory entries
  4510                                  		dw	5760 ; 2*36*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4511                                  		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4512                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors
  4513                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4514                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4515                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4516                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4517                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4518                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4519                                  
  4520                                  		db 90h			;
  4521                                  ;align 2
  4522                                  
  4523                                  %endif
  4524                                  
  4525                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4526                                  					; align	2
  4527                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4528                                  %if 0
  4529                                  bpbtable:	dw bpb48t		; 48tpi	drives
  4530                                  		dw bpb96t		; 96tpi	drives
  4531                                  		dw bpb35		; 3.5" drives
  4532                                  		dw bpb35		; unused 8" diskette
  4533                                  		dw bpb35		; unused 8" diskette
  4534                                  		dw bpb35		; used for hard	disk
  4535                                  		dw bpb35		; used for tape	drive
  4536                                  		dw bpb35		; FFOTHER
  4537                                  		dw bpb35		; ERIMO
  4538                                  		dw bpb288		; 2.88MB drive
  4539                                  		;
  4540                                  		;dw bpb144		; 1.44MB drive - Retro DOS v4.0 feature !
  4541                                  %endif
  4542                                  
  4543                                  ; 13/12/2022
  4544                                  %if 0
  4545                                  BPBTABLE:	dw BPB48T		; 48tpi	drives
  4546                                  		dw BPB96T		; 96tpi	drives
  4547                                  		dw BPB35		; 3.5" drives
  4548                                  		dw BPB35		; unused 8" diskette
  4549                                  		dw BPB35		; unused 8" diskette
  4550                                  		dw BPB35		; used for hard	disk
  4551                                  		dw BPB35		; used for tape	drive
  4552                                  		dw BPB35		; FFOTHER
  4553                                  		dw BPB35		; ERIMO
  4554                                  		dw BPB288		; 2.88MB drive
  4555                                  		;

  4557

  4560                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4561                                  
  4562                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4563                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4564                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4565                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4566                                  ;
  4567                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4568                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4569                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4570                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4571                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4572                                  ;	  and a retf
  4573                                  
  4574                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4575                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4576                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4577                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4578                                  
  4579                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4580                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4581 0000161F [CC00]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4582                                  
  4583                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4584                                  
  4585                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4586 00001621 2EFF36[1F16]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4587                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4588 00001626 2EFF36[BF06]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4589 0000162B 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4590 0000162C CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4591                                  
  4592                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4593                                  
  4594 0000162D 00                      flp_drvs	db 0			
  4595                                  
  4596                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4597                                  
  4598                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4599                                  
  4600                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4601                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4602                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4603                                  
  4604                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4605                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4606                                  		;=============================================================
  4607                                  		;
  4608                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4609                                  		;
  4610                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4611                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4612                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4613                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4614                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4615                                  
  4616                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4617                                  		;=============================================================
  4618                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4619                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4620                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4621                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4622                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4623                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4624                                  		
  4625 0000162E FA                      		cli
  4626                                  
  4627                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4628                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4629                                  		;push	ax
  4630                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4631                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4632                                  		;pop	ax
  4633                                  	
  4634                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4635                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4636                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4637                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4638                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4639                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4640                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4641                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4642                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4643                                  
  4644                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4645                                  
  4646                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4647                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4648                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4649                                  
  4650 0000162F 2EA3[8A15]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4651 00001633 2E891E[8815]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4652                                  
  4653                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4654                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4655                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4656                                  
  4657 00001638 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4658 00001639 07                      		pop	es
  4659 0000163A 51                      		push	cx
  4660 0000163B 57                      		push	di
  4661                                  
  4662                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4663                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4664                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4665                                  		; ds = cs
  4666 0000163C 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4667 0000163E 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4668                                  		; ds = 0
  4669                                  
  4670 00001640 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4671                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4672                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4673                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4674 00001642 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4675                                  next_int_:		
  4676 00001645 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4677 00001646 AC                      		lodsb		
  4678                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4679 00001647 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4680 00001648 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4681 0000164A D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4682 0000164C 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4683 0000164E 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4684                                  					; saving address in di
  4685 00001650 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4686 00001651 AB                      		stosw
  4687 00001652 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4688 00001653 AB                      		stosw			; save the vector
  4689 00001654 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4690 00001656 E2ED                    		loop	next_int_
  4691 00001658 5F                      		pop	di
  4692 00001659 59                      		pop	cx
  4693                                  
  4694                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4695                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4696                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4697                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4698                                  
  4699                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4700                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4701                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4702                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4703                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4704                                  
  4705                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4706 0000165A C7064C00[4F07]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4707                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4708                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4709 00001660 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4710                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4711 00001664 C7065400[FE07]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4712                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4713                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4714 0000166A 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4715                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4716 0000166E C7066400[BE07]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4717                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4718                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4719 00001674 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4720                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4721                                  
  4722                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4723 00001678 0E                      		push	cs
  4724 00001679 1F                      		pop	ds
  4725                                  		
  4726 0000167A A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4727 0000167D A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4728 00001680 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4729 00001683 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4730                                  					; ;
  4731 00001686 FB                      		sti
  4732 00001687 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4733                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4734                                  
  4735                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4736                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4737                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4738                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4739                                  ;
  4740                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4741                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4742                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4743                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4744                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4745                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4746                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4747                                  
  4748                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4749                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4750                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4751                                  ;
  4752                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4753                                  ; to do anything special.
  4754                                  ;
  4755                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4756                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4757                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4758                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4759                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4760                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4761                                  
  4762                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4763 00001689 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4764                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4765 0000168B 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4766                                  
  4767                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4768                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4769                                  ;
  4770                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4771                                  ;
  4772                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4773                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4774                                  
  4775 0000168D 50                      		push	ax
  4776 0000168E 53                      		push	bx
  4777 0000168F 51                      		push	cx
  4778 00001690 52                      		push	dx
  4779 00001691 57                      		push	di
  4780 00001692 06                      		push	es
  4781 00001693 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4782 00001695 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4783 00001697 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4784                                  					; DL = drive number
  4785                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4786                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4787                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4788 00001699 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4789                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4790                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4791                                  		; ds = cs
  4792 0000169B 8816[2D16]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4793                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4794 0000169F 07                      		pop	es
  4795 000016A0 5F                      		pop	di
  4796 000016A1 5A                      		pop	dx
  4797 000016A2 59                      		pop	cx
  4798 000016A3 5B                      		pop	bx
  4799 000016A4 58                      		pop	ax
  4800 000016A5 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4801                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4802                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4803                                  
  4804                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4805                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4806                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4807                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4808 000016A7 A0[2D16]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4809 000016AA 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4810 000016AC 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4811                                  
  4812                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4813                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4814 000016AE 48                      		dec	ax
  4815 000016AF EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4816                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4817                                  
  4818                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4819                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4820 000016B1 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4821 000016B4 A2[9D15]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4822                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4823                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4824                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4825 000016B7 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4826                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4827                                  
  4828                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4829 000016B9 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4830 000016BB D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4831                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4832                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4833                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4834 000016BD 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4835 000016BF 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4836 000016C1 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4837                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4838                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4839                                  		; ds = cs
  4840 000016C2 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4841                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4842                                  notsingle:				
  4843 000016C6 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4844                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4845                                  					; booted off hard file
  4846 000016C7 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4847                                  
  4848                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4849                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4850                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4851                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4852                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4853                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4854                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4855                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4856                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4857                                  
  4858                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4859                                  
  4860 000016C9 F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4861 000016CC 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4862 000016CE 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4863                                  gothrd:					
  4864 000016D0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4865                                  					; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4866                                  					; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4867                                  					; ch = media byte
  4868 000016D2 FA                      		cli
  4869 000016D3 8ED2                    		mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4870 000016D5 BC0007                  		mov	sp, 700h
  4871 000016D8 FB                      		sti
  4872 000016D9 51                      		push	cx ; *		; save number of floppies and media byte
  4873 000016DA 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4874 000016DC 50                      		push	ax ; **		; save boot drive number and media byte
  4875                                  		
  4876                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4877                                  
  4878 000016DD B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4879 000016DF CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4880 000016E1 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4881 000016E3 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4882 000016E6 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4883                                  
  4884                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4885                                  		; ds = cs
  4886 000016E8 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_modelbyte]
  4887 000016EC A2[3606]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4888                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  4889                                  					; get/save model byte

  5211                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of

  5215                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.

  5219                                  ;

  5238                                  
  5239                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5240                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5241                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5242                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5243                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5244                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5245                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5246                                  ; the bds for harddrives.

  5288                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when

  5546                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5547                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5548                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5549                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5550                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.

  5563                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5564                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5565                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5566                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5567                                  ;
  5568                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5569                                  ;
  5570                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5571                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5572                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5573                                  ;use to start with.
  5574                                  ;
  5575                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5576                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5577                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5578                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5579                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5580

  5648                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5649                                  
  5650                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5651                                  ;
  5652                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5653                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5654                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5655                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5656                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5657                                  ; off of it.
  5658                                  ;
  5659                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5660                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5661                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5662                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5663                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5664                                  
  5665                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5666                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5667                                  checkcompaqbug:
  5668                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5669                                  		; es = 0F000h
  5670                                  		;mov	ax, 0F000h	; point	to ROM BIOS
  5671                                  		;mov	es, ax
  5672                                  
  5673                                  		; 19/10/2022
  5674 00001A1B 26813EEAFF434F          		cmp	word [es:0FFEAh], 'CO'
  5675                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEAh, 'OC' ; look for COMPAQ
  5676 00001A22 754B                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5677 00001A24 26813EECFF4D50          		cmp	word [es:0FFECh], 'MP'
  5678                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFECh, 'PM'
  5679 00001A2B 7542                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5680 00001A2D 26813EEEFF4151          		cmp	word [es:0FFEEh], 'AQ'
  5681                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEEh, 'QA'
  5682 00001A34 7539                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5683                                  
  5684                                  ; We're running on a COMPAQ. Now look at the date code.
  5685                                  
  5686 00001A36 26A1FBFF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFFBh]	; get year
  5687 00001A3A 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5688 00001A3C 3D3638                  		cmp	ax, 3836h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5689                                  		;cmp	ax, '86'        ; 3836h
  5690                                  					; is it	86?
  5691 00001A3F 772E                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch
  5692 00001A41 7218                    		jb	short do_compaq_patch
  5693 00001A43 26A1F5FF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFF5h]	; get month
  5694 00001A47 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5695 00001A49 3D3830                  		cmp	ax, 3038h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5696                                  		;cmp	ax, '08'        ; 3038h
  5697                                  					; is it	08?

  5955                                  
  5956                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5957                                  ;
  5958                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5959                                  
  5960                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5961                                  
  5962                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5963                                  ; module name: remap
  5964                                  ;
  5965                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5966                                  ;
  5967                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5968                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5969                                  ;
  5970                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5971                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5972                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5973                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5974                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5975                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5976                                  
  5977                                  ; input:       none
  5978                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5979                                  ; exit error:  none
  5980                                  ; called from: msinit
  5981                                  ;
  5982                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5983                                  ;	  found in the system
  5984                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5985                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5986                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5987                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5988                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5989                                  ;
  5990                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5991                                  
  5992                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5993                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5994                                  
  5995                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5996 00001B14 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5997                                  
  5998                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5999                                  
  6000                                  drive_loop:				
  6001 00001B19 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6002                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6003 00001B1D 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6004 00001B1F 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6005                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6006 00001B21 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  6007 00001B24 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6008 00001B26 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6009                                  
  6010                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6011                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6012                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6013                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6014                                  
  6015                                  fdrv_found:				
  6016 00001B28 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6017                                  fdrv_loop:				
  6018 00001B2A 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6019                                  					; found	??
  6020 00001B2D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6021                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6022                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6023                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6024 00001B2F 40                      		inc	ax
  6025 00001B30 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  6026 00001B33 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  6027                                  
  6028                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6029                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6030                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6031                                  ; any more.
  6032                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6033                                  
  6034 00001B35 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6035                                  					; get first bds
  6036 00001B3A 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6037                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6038 00001B3C 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6039 00001B41 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6040                                  remap_loop1:				
  6041 00001B44 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6042                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6043 00001B46 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6044 00001B49 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6045 00001B4B FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  6046 00001B4D 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6047                                  
  6048                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6049                                  
  6050 00001B4F 2EA0[8615]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6051 00001B53 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6052 00001B55 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6053 00001B57 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  6054 00001B5C 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6055                                  
  6056                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6057                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6058                                  
  6059 00001B5E 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6060 00001B60 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6061                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6062                                  
  6063                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6064                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6065                                  
  6066                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  6067 00001B62 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6068                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6069 00001B67 2EA2[8615]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6070 00001B6B FEC0                    		inc	al
  6071 00001B6D 1E                      		push	ds
  6072 00001B6E BF4504                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6073                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6074 00001B71 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6075 00001B73 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6076                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6077                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6078 00001B76 1F                      		pop	ds
  6079                                  rmap_exit:				
  6080 00001B77 C3                      		retn
  6081                                  
  6082                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6083                                  
  6084                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6085                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6086                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6087                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6088                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6089                                  ;**************************************************
  6090                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6091                                  ;
  6092                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6093                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6094                                  ;
  6095                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6096                                  ;**************************************************
  6097                                  
  6098                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6099                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6100                                  
  6101                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  6102                                  		
  6103                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6104                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6105                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6106                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6107                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6108                                  
  6109 00001B78 2EA1[9115]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6110 00001B7C 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6111                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6112 00001B7E BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6113                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6114                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6115 00001B81 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6116 00001B84 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6117 00001B86 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6118 00001B89 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6119                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6120                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6121                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6122 00001B8B 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6123                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6124 00001B8D 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6125                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6126                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6127 00001B94 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6128                                  erret:					
  6129 00001B96 F9                      		stc
  6130                                  norm_ret:				
  6131 00001B97 C3                      		retn
  6132                                  
  6133                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6134                                  
  6135                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6136                                  
  6137                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6138                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6139                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6140                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6141                                  ;   determine version number
  6142                                  ;
  6143                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6144                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6145                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6146                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6147                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6148                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6149                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6150                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6151                                  
  6152                                  sethard:	; proc near
  6153                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6154                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6155 00001B98 57                      		push	di
  6156 00001B99 53                      		push	bx
  6157                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  6158 00001B9A 06                      		push	es
  6159 00001B9B 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6160 00001B9E 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6161 00001BA1 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6162                                  					; fnon_removable
  6163 00001BA5 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6164                                  					; ffHardFile
  6165 00001BA9 C606[8E15]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6166 00001BAE 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6167 00001BB0 52                      		push	dx
  6168 00001BB1 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6169 00001BB3 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6170                                  					; DL = drive number
  6171                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6172                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6173                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6174 00001BB5 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6175 00001BB7 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6176 00001BBA 5A                      		pop	dx
  6177 00001BBB 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6178 00001BBD 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6179 00001BC0 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6180 00001BC3 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6181 00001BC4 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  6182 00001BC7 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6183 00001BC8 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6184 00001BCA BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6185                                  
  6186                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6187                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6188                                  
  6189                                  act_part:
  6190 00001BCD 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6191 00001BD2 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6192 00001BD4 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6193 00001BD8 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6194 00001BDA 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6195 00001BDE 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6196 00001BE0 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6197 00001BE4 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6198                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  6199 00001BE6 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6200                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  6201 00001BE8 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6202 00001BEA FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6203                                  no_act:					
  6204 00001BEC 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6205 00001BEF 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6206                                  					; last entry done?
  6207 00001BF3 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6208 00001BF5 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6209                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6210                                  
  6211                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6212                                  
  6213                                  get_primary:
  6214 00001BF8 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6215 00001BFD 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6216                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6217 00001BFF 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6218 00001C03 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6219 00001C05 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6220 00001C09 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6221 00001C0B 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6222 00001C0F 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6223                                  got_prim:
  6224 00001C11 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6225 00001C13 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6226 00001C15 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6227                                  not_prim:
  6228 00001C17 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6229 00001C1A 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6230 00001C1E 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6231                                  setret:					
  6232 00001C20 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6233 00001C21 E99A02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6234                                  
  6235                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6236                                  
  6237                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6238                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6239                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6240                                  ;
  6241                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6242                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6243                                  ;  without change.
  6244                                  ;
  6245                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6246                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6247                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6248                                  
  6249                                  set2:		
  6250                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6251                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6252 00001C24 8816[9315]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6253                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6254                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6255 00001C28 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6256 00001C2C 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6257                                  
  6258                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6259                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6260                                  
  6261 00001C30 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6262 00001C33 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6263 00001C36 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6264 00001C3A 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6265 00001C3E 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6266 00001C40 800E[8E15]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6267                                  okdrive:
  6268 00001C45 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6269 00001C49 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6270                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6271 00001C4C 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6272 00001C50 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6273 00001C53 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6274 00001C57 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6275 00001C5B 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6276 00001C5E 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6277                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6278 00001C61 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6279 00001C64 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6280 00001C66 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6281 00001C69 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6282                                  okdrive_1:
  6283 00001C6B 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6284 00001C6E 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6285 00001C71 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6286                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6287 00001C73 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6288 00001C76 50                      		push	ax
  6289 00001C77 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6290 00001C79 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6291 00001C7B F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6292                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6293                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6294                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6295                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6296 00001C7D A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  6297 00001C80 58                      		pop	ax
  6298 00001C81 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6299 00001C83 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6300 00001C85 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6301 00001C87 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6302 00001C89 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6303 00001C8C 50                      		push	ax
  6304 00001C8D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6305                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6306 00001C8F A1[2105]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 12/08/2023
  6307 00001C92 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6308                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6309 00001C94 A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 12/08/2023
  6310 00001C97 58                      		pop	ax
  6311 00001C98 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6312                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6313 00001C9A 833E[2105]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  6314                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6315 00001C9F 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6316 00001CA1 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6317 00001CA4 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6318                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6319                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6320                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6321                                  okdrive_2:
  6322                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6323                                  ; dl is head.
  6324                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6325                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6326                                  
  6327                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6328                                  
  6329 00001CA6 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6330                                  					; check for mini disk
  6331 00001CAA 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6332 00001CAC 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6333                                  					; set the physical track number
  6334                                  oknotmini:
  6335                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6336                                  				
  6337 00001CAF D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  6338 00001CB1 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6339 00001CB3 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  6340 00001CB6 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  6341 00001CB8 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch iscylinder (low 8 bits)
  6342                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6343 00001CBA 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6344                                  		
  6345                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6346 00001CBC 8A16[9315]              		mov	dl, [rom_drv_num]
  6347                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6348                                  
  6349                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6350                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6351                                  ; dh is head
  6352                                  ; dl is drive
  6353                                  
  6354                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6355                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6356                                  
  6357                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6358                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6359                                  
  6360 00001CC0 0E                      		push	cs
  6361 00001CC1 07                      		pop	es
  6362 00001CC2 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6363                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6364                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6365 00001CC5 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6366 00001CC8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6367                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6368                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6369                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6370                                  
  6371                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6372                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6373                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6374                                  
  6375                                  		; 11/08/2023
  6376                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  6377                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6378 00001CCA 53                      		push	bx
  6379 00001CCB 50                      		push	ax
  6380                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6381                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  6382 00001CCC 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  6383                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6384 00001CCF 740B                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6385 00001CD1 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  6386                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6387 00001CD4 7525                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6388 00001CD6 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  6389                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6390 00001CDA 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  6391                                  check_1_ok:
  6392                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6393 00001CDC BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6394                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6395                                  					; point to the bpb in the boot record
  6396                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6397 00001CDF 8A470A                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 12/08/2023 
  6398                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6399 00001CE2 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6400 00001CE4 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6401 00001CE6 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  6402                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6403 00001CE8 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 12/08/2023
  6404 00001CEC 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6405                                  
  6406                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6407 00001CEE 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 12/08/2023
  6408                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  6409                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  6410                                  					; a power of 2
  6411                                  					;
  6412                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6413                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6414 00001CF1 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it zero?
  6415 00001CF3 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6416                                  
  6417                                  ck_power_of_two:
  6418 00001CF5 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift until first bit emerges
  6419 00001CF7 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6420 00001CF9 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6421                                  
  6422                                  invalid_boot_record:
  6423 00001CFB 58                      		pop	ax
  6424 00001CFC 5B                      		pop	bx
  6425 00001CFD E90901                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6426                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6427                                  
  6428                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6429                                  	; 12/08/2023
  6430                                  setret_brdg:
  6431 00001D00 E91DFF                  		jmp	setret
  6432                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6433                                  
  6434                                  unknown3_0_j:
  6435 00001D03 E90701                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6436                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  6437                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6438                                  
  6439                                  valid_boot_record:
  6440 00001D06 58                      		pop	ax
  6441 00001D07 5B                      		pop	bx
  6442                                  
  6443                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  6444                                  
  6445                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6446 00001D08 817F08322E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '2.'
  6447                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6448                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E32h ; '2.'
  6449 00001D0D 7506                    		jnz	short try5
  6450 00001D0F 807F0A30                		cmp	byte [bx+10], '0'
  6451                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+0Ah], '0' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6452                                  		;;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 30h ; '0'
  6453                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6454                                  		;jnz	short try5
  6455                                  		;jmp	short copybpb
  6456 00001D13 7425                    		jz	short copybpb
  6457                                  
  6458                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6459                                  ;	; 12/08/2023
  6460                                  ;setret_brdg:
  6461                                  ;		jmp	setret
  6462                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6463                                  ;
  6464                                  ;unknown3_0_j:
  6465                                  ;		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6466                                  ;					; although, content might be bad.
  6467                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6468                                  
  6469                                  try5:
  6470 00001D15 E8AA01                  		call	cover_fdisk_bug
  6471                                  
  6472                                  ; see if it is an os2 signature
  6473                                  
  6474                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6475                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment
  6476 00001D18 817F08302E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '0.'
  6477                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '0.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6478                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E30h ; '0.'
  6479 00001D1D 750C                    		jnz	short no_os2
  6480 00001D1F 8A4707                  		mov	al, [bx+7] ; 12/08/2023
  6481                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+7]	; 17/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6482 00001D22 2C31                    		sub	al, '1'

  6873

  6875                                  					; save number of (root)	dir entries
  6876 00001E36 8B551D                  		mov	dx, [di+1Dh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]

  6878 00001E3C 886D08                  		mov	[di+8],	ch	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  6879                                  					; save sectors per cluster
  6880                                  		; 11/09/2023
  6881                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6882 00001E3F F606[8E15]40            		test	byte [fbigfat], 40h
  6883                                  		;test	ds:fbigfat, 40h	; fbig
  6884                                  					; if (fbigfat)
  6885 00001E44 751E                    		jnz	short dobig	; goto dobig; (16 bit fat)
  6886                                  
  6887                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is guaranteed
  6888                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6889                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6890                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  6891                                  
  6892 00001E46 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; 12 bit fat (FAT12 fs)
  6893 00001E48 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch
  6894 00001E4A 4B                      		dec	bx

  6897 00001E4F 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus
