  9198                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  9199                                  ;*									*
  9200                                  ;************************************************************************
  9201                                  
  9202                                  getbx:	
  9203 00000384 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  9204                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  9205                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  9206 00000388 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  9207                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9208                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  9209 0000038C C3                      		retn
  9210                                  
  9211                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9212                                  
  9213                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9214                                  
  9215                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9216                                  ;								:
  9217                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  9218                                  ;								:
  9219                                  ;								:
  9220                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  9221                                  ;								:
  9222                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  9223                                  ;								:
  9224                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  9225                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  9226                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  9227                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  9228                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  9229                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  9230                                  ;								:
  9231                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  9232                                  ;								:
  9233                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  9234                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  9235                                  ;								:
  9236                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9237                                  
  9238                                  ; convert time to ticks
  9239                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  9240                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  9241                                  
  9242                                  ;19/07/2019
  9243                                  ;09/03/2019
  9244                                  
  9245                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  9246                                  
  9247                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9248                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9249                                  
  9250 0000038D B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9251 0000038F F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9252 00000391 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9253 00000393 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9254 00000395 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9255 00000398 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9256 0000039A F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9257 0000039C 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9258 0000039E B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9259 000003A0 F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9260 000003A2 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9261 000003A4 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9262 000003A7 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9263 000003A9 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9264 000003AB 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9265                                  
  9266                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9267                                  
  9268 000003AE 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9269 000003AF 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9270 000003B0 BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9271 000003B3 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9272 000003B5 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9273 000003B7 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9274 000003B8 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9275 000003BA 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9276 000003BC 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9277 000003BF 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9278 000003C0 BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9279 000003C3 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9280 000003C5 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9281 000003C7 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9282 000003C9 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9283 000003CB 98                      		cbw
  9284 000003CC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9285 000003CD F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9286 000003CF 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9287 000003D1 CB                      		retf			; far return
  9288                                  
  9289                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9290                                  
  9291                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9292                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9293                                  
  9294                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9295                                  ;
  9296                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9297                                  ;
  9298                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9299                                  ;
  9300                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9301                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9302                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9303                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9304                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9305                                  ;
  9306                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9307                                  ;
  9308                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9309                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9310                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9311                                  ;
  9312                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9313                                  
  9314                                  	; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9315                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:03EAh
  9316                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9317 000003D2 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9318 000003D5 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9319                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9320 000003D6 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9321                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9322 000003DB 7423                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9323 000003DD 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9324                                  					; get binary hours
  9325                                  					; convert to bcd
  9326                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  9327                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9328                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9329 000003E1 E8E800                  		call	bintobcd
  9330 000003E4 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9331 000003E6 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9332                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  9333                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9334 000003EA E8DF00                  		call	bintobcd
  9335 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9336 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9337                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  9338                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd
  9339 000003F3 E8D600                  		call	bintobcd
  9340                                  
  9341 000003F6 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9342 000003F8 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9343 000003FA FA                      		cli
  9344 000003FB B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9345 000003FD CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9346                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9347                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9348                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9349 000003FF FB                      		sti
  9350                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9351 00000400 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9352 00000404 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9353                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9354 00000408 FF1E[C106]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9355                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9356                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9357                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9358 0000040C FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9359 0000040D B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9360 0000040F CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9361                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9362                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9363                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9364 00000411 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9365 00000415 FB                      		sti
  9366                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9367 00000416 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9368 0000041B 7409                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9369                                  
  9370                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9371                                  		;call	far [daycnttoday]

  9373                                  					; convert to bcd format

  9375                                  
  9376 00000420 FA                      		cli
  9377 00000421 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9378 00000423 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9379                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9380                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9381                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9382 00000425 FB                      		sti
  9383                                  no_cmos_2:
  9384                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9385                                  		; cf=0
  9386                                  		;clc
  9387 00000426 C3                      		retn

  9391                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9392                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0440h
  9393                                  %if 1

  9395                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.
  9396                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
  9397                                  
  9398                                  daycnttoday:	; proc near
  9399                                  
  9400                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
  9401                                  ;
  9402                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
  9403                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
  9404                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
  9405                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
  9406                                  
  9407                                  		; 08/08/2023 (ds:) (near proc)
  9408                                  		; 16/10/2022 (cs:) (far proc)		
  9409 00000427 FF36[F004]              		push	word [daycnt] ; save daycnt
  9410 0000042B 813E[F004]891C          		cmp	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
  9411                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
  9412 00000431 7308                    		jnb	short century20
  9413                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 19
  9414                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 80
  9415                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9416 00000433 C706[F404]1350          		mov	word [base_century], 5013h
  9417 00000439 EB0C                    		jmp	short years
  9418                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9419                                  		
  9420                                  century20:				
  9421                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 20
  9422                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 0
  9423                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9424 0000043B C706[F404]1400          		mov	word [base_century], 20
  9425 00000441 812E[F004]891C          		sub	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
  9426                                  					; adjust daycnt
  9427                                  years:					
  9428 00000447 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  9429 00000449 A1[F004]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
  9430 0000044C BBB505                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
  9431                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
  9432 0000044F F7F3                    		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
  9433 00000451 8916[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
  9434 00000455 B304                    		mov	bl, 4
  9435 00000457 F6E3                    		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
  9436 00000459 0006[F504]              		add	[base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
  9437 0000045D FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
  9438                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9439 00000461 BB6E01                  		mov	bx, 366
  9440 00000464 B90300                  		mov	cx, 3
  9441                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 366 ; daycnt=remainder of leap year
  9442 00000467 391E[F004]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 366
  9443 0000046B 7619                    		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
  9444 0000046D FE06[F504]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
  9445                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 366 ; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
  9446 00000471 291E[F004]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 366 ; 08/08/2023
  9447                                  		;mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
  9448                                  regularyear:	
  9449                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9450 00000475 4B                      		dec	bx ; 365			
  9451                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 365 ; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365; i++)
  9452 00000476 391E[F004]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
  9453 0000047A 760F                    		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
  9454 0000047C FE06[F504]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; { daycnt -=	365
  9455                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 365 ; }
  9456 00000480 291E[F004]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023 
  9457 00000484 E2EF                    		loop	regularyear	; }
  9458                                  					;
  9459                                  					; should never fall through loop
  9460                                  leapyear:	
  9461 00000486 C606[F704]1D            		mov	byte [february], 29 ; 08/08/2023			
  9462                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
  9463                                  					; change month table.
  9464                                  yeardone:				
  9465 0000048B 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  9466 0000048D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  9467 0000048F A1[F004]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
  9468                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
  9469 00000492 BE[F604]                		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
  9470                                  		;mov	cx, 12
  9471                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9472 00000495 B10C                    		mov	cl, 12
  9473                                  months:					
  9474 00000497 FEC3                    		inc	bl
  9475                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9476 00000499 8A14                    		mov	dl, [si]	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:04B7h
  9477 0000049B 39D0                    		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
  9478                                  					; dh=0
  9479 0000049D 7605                    		jbe	short month_done
  9480 0000049F 46                      		inc	si		; next month
  9481 000004A0 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt
  9482 000004A2 E2F3                    		loop	months		;
  9483                                  					; should never fall through loop
  9484                                  month_done:	
  9485 000004A4 C606[F704]1C            		mov	byte [february], 28 ; 08/08/2023
  9486                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 28
  9487                                  					; restore month table value
  9488 000004A9 88DA                    		mov	dl, bl
  9489 000004AB 8A36[F504]              		mov	dh, [base_year]
  9490 000004AF 8A0E[F404]              		mov	cl, [base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
  9491 000004B3 E81600                  		call	bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
  9492                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
  9493 000004B6 86D0                    		xchg	dl, al
  9494 000004B8 E81100                  		call	bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
  9495 000004BB 86F0                    		xchg	dh, al
  9496 000004BD E80C00                  		call	bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
  9497 000004C0 86C8                    		xchg	cl, al
  9498 000004C2 E80700                  		call	bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
  9499 000004C5 88C5                    		mov	ch, al
  9500 000004C7 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt] ; restore original value
  9501 000004CB C3                      		retn
  9502                                  
  9503                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9504                                  
  9505                                  bintobcd:	; proc near		; real time clock support
  9506                                  
  9507                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
  9508                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
  9509                                  		
  9510 000004CC D40A                    		aam			; AH = AL/10, AL = AL MOD 10
  9511 000004CE D510                    		aad     10h             ; db 0D5h,10h
  9512                                  					; AL = (AH*10H)+AL, AH = 0
  9513 000004D0 C3                      		retn
  9514                                  %endif

  9516                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9517                                  
  9518                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9519                                  
  9520                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9521                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9522                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9523                                  ;
  9524                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9525                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9526                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9527                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9528                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9529                                  ;
  9530                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9531                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9532                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9533                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9534                                  
  9535                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9536 000004D1 E84B00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9537 000004D4 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9538                                  
  9539                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9540                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9541                                  ;
  9542                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9543                                  ;	       ----------------
  9544                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9545                                  ;
  9546                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9547                                  ;
  9548                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9549                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9550                                  ;		1,193,180
  9551                                  ;
  9552                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9553                                  ;
  9554                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9555                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9556                                  ;		59,659
  9557                                  ;
  9558                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9559                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9560                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9561                                  ;
  9562                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9563                                  ; multiply by 5
  9564                                  
  9565 000004D8 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9566 000004DA 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9567                                  					; multiply by 5
  9568 000004DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9569 000004DE D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9570 000004E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9571 000004E2 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9572 000004E4 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9573 000004E6 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9574 000004E8 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9575                                  
  9576                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9577                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9578                                  
  9579 000004E9 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9580 000004EC F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9581                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9582                                  
  9583                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9584                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9585 000004EE 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9586 000004EF 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9587 000004F1 F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9588                                  
  9589                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9590                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9591                                  
  9592 000004F3 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9593 000004F5 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9594                                  
  9595                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9596                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9597                                  
  9598 000004F8 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9599 000004FA 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9600 000004FD 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9601 000004FF 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9602                                  noadj:					
  9603 00000502 F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9604 00000503 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9605                                  
  9606                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9607                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9608                                  
  9609 00000505 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9610 00000507 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9611 00000509 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9612 0000050B B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9613 0000050E F7F1                    		div	cx
  9614 00000510 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9615 00000512 F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9616 00000514 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9617                                  
  9618                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9619                                  
  9620                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9621                                  		;push	ax
  9622                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9623 00000516 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9624 00000517 AB                      		stosw
  9625                                  		;pop	ax
  9626 00000518 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9627 00000519 AB                      		stosw
  9628 0000051A 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9629 0000051C AB                      		stosw
  9630 0000051D F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9631                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9632                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9633                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9634                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9635 0000051E C3                      		retn
  9636                                  
  9637                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9638                                  
  9639                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9640                                  
  9641                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9642                                  ;
  9643                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9644                                  ;
  9645                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9646                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9647                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9648                                  ;
  9649                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9650                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9651                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9652                                  ;			else
  9653                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9654                                  ;		}
  9655                                  ;
  9656                                  ; USES : AX
  9657                                  ;
  9658                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9659                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9660                                  ;
  9661                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9662                                  
  9663                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9664                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9665 0000051F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9666 00000521 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9667                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9668                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9669                                  					; midnight
  9670                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9671 00000523 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9672 00000528 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9673 0000052A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9674                                  					; and not flag
  9675 0000052C 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9676 00000530 C3                      		retn
  9677                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9678                                  
  9679                                  inc_case:				
  9680 00000531 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9681 00000533 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9682 00000535 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9683                                  no_rollover:				
  9684 00000539 C3                      		retn
  9685

  9713                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9714                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9715                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9716                                  
  9717                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9718                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9719                                  
  9720                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9721                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9722                                  
  9723                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9724                                  
  9725                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9726                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9727                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9728                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9729                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9730                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9731                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9732                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9733                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9734                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9735                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9736                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9737                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9738                                  
  9739                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9740                                  
  9741                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9742                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9743                                  ;
  9744                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9745                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9746                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9747                                  ;   else
  9748                                  ;	set slow = value
  9749                                  ;   ...
  9750                                  ;*********************************************
  9751                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9752                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9753                                  ;*	 use slow
  9754                                  ;*   else
  9755                                  ;*	 use fast
  9756                                  ;*********************************************
  9757                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9758                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9759                                  ;	use slow
  9760                                  ;   else
  9761                                  ;	use fast
  9762                                  ;   ...
  9763                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9764                                  ;
  9765                                  ;
  9766                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9767                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9768                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9769                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9770                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9771                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9772                                  
  9773                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9774                                  
  9775                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9776                                  
  9777                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9778                                  
  9779                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9780                                  ;	command jump table
  9781                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9782                                  
  9783 0000053A 00                      		db 0
  9784

  9787                                  
  9788                                  dsktbl:		db 26			; 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  9789                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26
  9790                                  		dw 1742h		; dsk_init
  9791                                  		dw 4EBh			; media_chk
  9792                                  		dw 592h			; get_bpb
  9793                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9794                                  		dw 857h			; dsk_read
  9795                                  		dw 83Dh			; x_bus_exit
  9796                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9797                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9798                                  		dw 849h			; dsk_writ
  9799                                  		dw 841h			; dsk_writv
  9800                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9801                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9802                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9803                                  		dw 80Ah			; dsk_open
  9804                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close
  9805                                  		dw 831h			; dsk_rem
  9806                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9807                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9808                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9809                                  		dw 0C6Bh		; do_generic_ioctl
  9810                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9811                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9853                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9854                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9855                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9856                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9857                                  ;
  9858                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9859                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9860                                  
  9861                                  SetDrive:

  9864                                  X_Scan_Loop:

  9866 00000578 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv

  9868 0000057D 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh

  9878                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9879                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9880                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9881                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9882                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed

  9914

  9916                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9917                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.

  9967                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

  9969                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9970                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9971                                  ; drive.
  9972                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9973                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9974                                  ; returns in si:
  9975                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9976                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9977                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9978                                  ;
  9979                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9980                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9981                                  
  9982                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9983                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9984 000005F6 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9985 000005F9 E823FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9986 000005FC 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9987                                  					; get stored time
  9988 00000600 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9989 00000602 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9990 00000606 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9991                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9992                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
  9993                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
  9994 00000608 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9995 0000060A 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9996 0000060C 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9997                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9998                                  		;inc	al
  9999                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 10000                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 10001                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
 10002                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 10003                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 10004                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 10005                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10006                                  		;dec	al
 10007                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 10008                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10009 0000060E 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
 10010 00000613 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
 10011 00000615 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 10012 00000619 C3                      		retn
 10013

 10015                                  
 10016                                  timepassed:

 10019 0000061D 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 10020                                  
 10021                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.

 10104                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10105                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
 10106                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
 10107                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
 10108                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
 10109                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
 10110                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
 10111                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
 10112                                  ;
 10113                                  ;	trashes si, cx
 10114                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10115                                  
 10116                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 10117                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 10118                                  
 10119                                  ; 11/09/2023
 10120                                  ; 14/08/2023
 10121                                  ;BDS.fatsiz equ 1Fh

 10123                                  clear_ids:
 10124                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)
 10125 0000066A 268A451F                		mov	al, [es:di+1Fh] ; mov al,[es:di+BDS.fatsiz]
 10126                                  clear_ids_x:	; 11/09/2023		
 10127                                   		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05D9h)
 10128 0000066E 57                      		push	di
 10129 0000066F 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx		; no serial number
 10130 00000671 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10131 00000675 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10132                                  
 10133                                  		; BUGBUG - there's a lot in common here and with
 10134                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
 10135                                  		; merging them... jgl
 10136                                  
 10137                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10138                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10139 00000679 B10B                    		mov	cl, 11 ; cx = 11		
 10140                                  
 10141                                  		;mov	si, offset vol_no_name ; "NO NAME    "
 10142 0000067B BE[1505]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022
 10143 0000067E 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10144 00000681 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10145                                  		
 10146                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
 10147                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
 10148                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
 10149                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
 10150                                  
 10151                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 10152                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 10153                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 10154                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 10155                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 10156                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
 10157                                  			;
 10158                                  			; Correct Code:
 10159                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
 10160                                  			; 11/09/2023
 10161                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 10162                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 10163                                  			;
 10164                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
 10165                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 10166                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
 10167                                  			;
 10168                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 10169                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 10170                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 10171                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 10172                                  
 10173 00000683 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
 10174                                  		
 10175                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"
 10176 00000685 BE[0C05]                		mov	si, fat_16_id	; 19/10/2022

 10179 0000068A BE[0305]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	 ; 19/10/2022
 10180                                  ci_bigfat:				
 10181                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10182                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10183 0000068D B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8 
 10184 0000068F 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10185                                  					; filesys_id field

 10193                                  
 10194                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10195                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10196                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10197                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10198                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10199                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10200                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10201                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10202                                  ;
 10203                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10204                                  ;
 10205                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10206                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10207                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10208                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10209                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10210                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10211                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10212                                  ;
 10213                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10214                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10215                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10216                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10217                                  
 10218                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
 10219                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
 10220 00000696 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
 10221 0000069B 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
 10222 0000069D E99A00                  		jmp	getret_exit
 10223                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10224                                  
 10225                                  getbp1:					
 10226 000006A0 51                      		push	cx
 10227 000006A1 52                      		push	dx
 10228 000006A2 53                      		push	bx
 10229                                  
 10230                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
 10231                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
 10232                                  		; have a valid boot sector.

 10315

 10325 0000070E 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10326 00000710 895515                  		mov	[di+15h], dx	; [di+BDS.heads]
 10327 00000713 88FA                    		mov	dl, bh

 10383                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10384                                  
 10385                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10386                                  
 10387                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10388                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10389                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10390                                  ;
 10391                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10392                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10393                                  
 10394                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10395                                  
 10396                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 10397                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
 10398                                  
 10399                                  readbootsec:	
 10400 0000074F B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10401 00000751 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10402 00000754 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10403 00000757 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10404 00000759 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10405                                  
 10406                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10407                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10408                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10409                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10410                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10411                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10412                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10413                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10414                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10415                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10416                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10417                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10418                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10419                                  		; informations
 10420                                  
 10421                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10422                                  
 10423                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10424                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10425                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10426                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10427                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10428                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10429                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10430                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10431                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10432                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10433                                  
 10434                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10435 0000075B A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10436 0000075E 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10437 00000760 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10438                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10439 00000762 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10440 00000764 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10441                                  					; no need for nop
 10442 00000766 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10443 00000768 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10444 0000076A 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10445 0000076F 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10446                                  
 10447                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10448                                  ;
 10449                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10450                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10451                                  ;;
 10452                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10453                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10454                                  ;;
 10455                                  ;;check_signature:
 10456                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10457                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10458                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10459                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10460                                  
 10461                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10462                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10463                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10464                                  
 10465                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10466                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 10467 00000771 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10468                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10469 00000774 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10470 00000775 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10471 00000777 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10472 00000779 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10473 0000077A 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10474                                  
 10475                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10476                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10477                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10478                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10479                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10480                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10481                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10482                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10483                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10484                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10485                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10486                                  
 10487                                  checksinglesided:
 10488                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10489                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10490                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10491 0000077C 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10492 0000077E 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10493 00000780 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10494 00000782 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10495 00000784 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10496 0000078A 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10497 0000078C 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10498 00000791 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10499                                  
 10500                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10501                                  
 10502                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10503 00000793 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10504                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10505 00000798 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10506                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10507                                  
 10508                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10509 0000079A 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10510                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10511                                  movbpb_ret:
 10512                                  gooddsk:				
 10513 0000079B F8                      		clc
 10514                                  err_ret:
 10515 0000079C C3                      		retn
 10516                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10517                                  
 10518                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10519                                  ;err_ret:				
 10520                                  		;retn
 10521                                  
 10522                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10523                                  
 10524                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10525                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10526                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10527                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10528                                  ;
 10529                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10530                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10531                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10532                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10533                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10534                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10535                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10536                                  
 10537                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10538                                  
 10539                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10540                                  movbpb:	
 10541 0000079D 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10542                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10543                                  					; sectors per unit
 10544 000007A1 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10545                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10546                                  					; number of directory entries
 10547 000007A5 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10548                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10549                                  					; size of drive
 10550 000007A9 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10551                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10552                                  					; media	descriptor
 10553 000007AD A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10554                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10555                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10556 000007B0 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10557                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10558                                  					; sectors per track
 10559 000007B4 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10560                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10561                                  					; number of heads
 10562 000007B8 803E[0205]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10563 000007BD 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10564 000007BF E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10565 000007C2 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10566 000007C4 C606[0205]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10567                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10568 000007C9 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10569 000007CE 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10570 000007D0 E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10571                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10572                                  		; cf = 0
 10573                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10574                                  		;clc
 10575 000007D3 C3                      		retn
 10576                                  
 10577                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10578                                  
 10579                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10580                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10581                                  ;by es:di.
 10582                                  
 10583                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10584                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10585                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10586                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10587                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10588                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10589                                  
 10590                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10591                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10592 000007D4 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10593                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10594                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10595 000007D9 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10596 000007DB 51                      		push	cx
 10597 000007DC 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10598                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10599 000007E0 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10600 000007E4 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10601                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10602 000007E8 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10603 000007EC 57                      		push	di
 10604 000007ED 56                      		push	si
 10605 000007EE B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10606 000007F1 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10607                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10608                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10609 000007F4 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10610 000007F7 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10611                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10612                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10613 000007F9 B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10614 000007FB BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10615                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10616 000007FE 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10617 00000801 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10618 00000803 5E                      		pop	si
 10619 00000804 5F                      		pop	di
 10620 00000805 59                      		pop	cx
 10621                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10622                                  		; cf = 0
 10623                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10624                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10625 00000806 C3                      		retn
 10626                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10627                                  
 10628                                  mmi_not_ext:				
 10629 00000807 F9                      		stc
 10630 00000808 C3                      		retn
