 13823                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13824                                  
 13825                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13826                                  ;
 13827                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13828                                  ;
 13829                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13830                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13831                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13832                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13833                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13834                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13835                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13836                                  ;
 13837                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13838                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13839                                  ;
 13840                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13841                                  
 13842                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13843                                  HMAPtr:
 13844 0000143E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13845                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13846 00001443 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13847                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13848 00001447 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13849 0000144A 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13850 0000144C 803E[9C08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13851                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13852 00001451 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13853 00001453 FF1E[9808]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13854                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13855 00001457 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13856                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13857                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13858 0000145B C3                      		retn
 13859                                  
 13860                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13861                                  
 13862                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13863                                  
 13864                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13865                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13866                                  
 13867                                  move_sector:
 13868                                  
 13869                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13870                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13871                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13872                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13873                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13874                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13875                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13876                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13877                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13878                                  ;
 13879                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13880                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13881                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13882                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13883                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13884                                  
 13885 0000145C FC                      		cld
 13886 0000145D 51                      		push	cx
 13887 0000145E B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13888 00001461 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13889 00001465 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13890 00001467 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13891 0000146B 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13892 0000146D F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13893 0000146F 59                      		pop	cx
 13894 00001470 C3                      		retn
 13895                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13896                                  
 13897                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13898 00001471 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13899 00001473 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13900 00001475 59                      		pop	cx
 13901 00001476 C3                      		retn
 13902                                  
 13903                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13904                                  
 13905                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13906                                  
 13907                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13908                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13909                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13910                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13911                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13912                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13913                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13914                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13915                                  ;
 13916                                  ; input conditions:
 13917                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13918                                  ;
 13919                                  ; output:
 13920                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13921                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13922                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13923                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13924                                  
 13925                                  check_wrap:	
 13926 00001477 50                      		push	ax
 13927 00001478 53                      		push	bx
 13928 00001479 06                      		push	es
 13929 0000147A 57                      		push	di
 13930 0000147B E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13931 0000147E 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13932                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13933 00001480 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13934                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13935 00001485 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13936 00001487 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13937 0000148B 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13938 0000148D 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13939 00001490 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13940 00001492 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13941 00001494 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13942                                  
 13943                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13944                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13945                                  
 13946 00001496 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13947 00001498 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13948                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13949 0000149A 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13950 0000149B 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13951                                  					; if on	boundary
 13952                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13953                                  not_on_bound:
 13954 0000149D 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13955 000014A0 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13956 000014A2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13957 000014A4 40                      		inc	ax
 13958 000014A5 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13959 000014A7 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13960                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13961 000014AA 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13962 000014AE 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13963                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13964                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13965 000014B0 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13966 000014B2 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13967 000014B3 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13968                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13969 000014B5 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13970                                  
 13971                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13972                                  
 13973 000014B7 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13974 000014B9 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13975 000014BB 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13976                                  
 13977                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13978                                  
 13979 000014BD 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13980 000014BF 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13981 000014C1 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13982                                  no_head_bound:				
 13983 000014C2 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13984 000014C4 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13985 000014C5 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13986 000014C7 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13987 000014C9 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13988 000014CB 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13989 000014CE B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13990 000014D0 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13991 000014D2 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13992 000014D4 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13993 000014D6 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13994 000014D8 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13995 000014DA 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13996 000014DC 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13997                                  no_wrap:				
 13998 000014DE F8                      		clc
 13999 000014DF 5F                      		pop	di
 14000 000014E0 07                      		pop	es
 14001 000014E1 5B                      		pop	bx
 14002 000014E2 58                      		pop	ax
 14003 000014E3 C3                      		retn
 14004                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14005                                  
 14006                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14007 000014E4 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14008 000014E6 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14009 000014E8 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14010                                  
 14011                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14012                                  
 14013                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14014                                  
 14015                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14016                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14017                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14018                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14019                                  ;
 14020                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14021                                  
 14022                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14023                                  find_bds:	
 14024 000014EA C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14025                                  fbds_1:					
 14026 000014EE 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14027 000014F2 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14028 000014F4 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14029                                  					; go to next bds
 14030 000014F7 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14031 000014FA 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14032 000014FC F9                      		stc
 14033                                  fdbs_2:					
 14034 000014FD C3                      		retn
 14035                                  
 14036                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14037                                  
 14038                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14039                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14040                                  doint:
 14041                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14042 000014FE 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14043                                  					; get physical drive number
 14044                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14045                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14046                                  		
 14047 00001501 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14048 00001503 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14049 00001505 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14050                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14051 00001507 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14052                                  					; get request code
 14053                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14054 0000150A FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14055                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14056 0000150D 9D                      		popf
 14057                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14058                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14059 0000150E 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14060                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14061                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14062 00001513 9C                      		pushf
 14063                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14064 00001514 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14065                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14066                                  dointdone:				
 14067 00001517 C3                      		retn
 14068                                  
 14069                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14070                                  
 14071                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14072                                  
 14073                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14074                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14075                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14076                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14077                                  ;
 14078                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14079                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14080                                  ;
 14081                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14082                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14083                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14084                                  
 14085                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14086                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14087                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14088                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14089                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14090                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14091                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14092                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14093                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14094                                  ;end struc
 14095                                  
 14096                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14097                                  
 14098                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14099                                  ;	ah = function
 14100                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14101                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14102                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14103                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14104                                  ;   output conditions:
 14105                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14106                                  
 14107                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14108                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14109                                  ;
 14110                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14111                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14112                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14113                                  
 14114                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14115                                  
 14116                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14117                                  
 14118 00001518 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14119                                  
 14120                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14121                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14122                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14123                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14124                                  
 14125                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14126                                  
 14127                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14128                                  
 14129                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14130                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14131                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14132                                  
 14133                                  format_special_stuff:			
 14134 0000151C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14135 00001521 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14136 00001523 53                      		push	bx
 14137 00001524 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14138 00001527 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14139 0000152A 5B                      		pop	bx
 14140 0000152B EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14141                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14142                                  
 14143                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14144                                  
 14145                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14146                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14147                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14148                                  
 14149                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14150                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 14151 0000152D 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14152 0000152F 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14153 00001531 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14154 00001532 51                      		push	cx
 14155 00001533 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14156 00001535 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14157 00001537 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14158 00001539 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14159 0000153D 59                      		pop	cx
 14160 0000153E 58                      		pop	ax
 14161 0000153F 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14162                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14163 00001541 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14164 00001542 06                      		push	es
 14165                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14166 00001543 2EC41E[1815]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14167                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14168                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14169 00001548 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14170 0000154A 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14171 0000154D 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14172                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14173                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14174 00001551 07                      		pop	es
 14175 00001552 5B                      		pop	bx
 14176 00001553 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14177                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14178                                  
 14179                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14180                                  
 14181                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14182                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14183                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14184                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14185                                  
 14186                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 14187 00001555 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14188                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14189 0000155A 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14190 0000155C 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14191                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14192 00001561 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14193                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 14194 00001563 50                      		push	ax
 14195 00001564 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14196                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14197                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14198 00001566 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14199                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14200                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14201 0000156B 58                      		pop	ax
 14202 0000156C EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14203                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14204                                  
 14205                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14206                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14207                                  
 14208                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14209                                  
 14210                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14211                                  
 14212                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14213                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14214                                  
 14215                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14216 0000156E 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14217                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14218                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14219 0000156F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14220                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14221                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14222                                  
 14223                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14224                                  
 14225 00001574 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14226 00001577 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14227 0000157A 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14228                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14229                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 14230 0000157C 803E[2905]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14231 00001581 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14232                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14233                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14234                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 14235 00001583 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14236                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14237                                  		
 14238 00001588 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14239                                  		
 14240 00001589 803E[3606]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14241                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14242 0000158E 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14243                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14244                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 14245 00001590 9D                      		popf
 14246 00001591 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14247                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14248 00001593 1F                      		pop	ds
 14249 00001594 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14250                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14251                                  
 14252                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14253                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14254                                  ; a changeline error.
 14255                                  
 14256                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14257 00001597 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14258                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14259 00001599 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14260 0000159C 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14261 0000159E 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14262 000015A0 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14263 000015A2 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14264 000015A7 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14265                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14266                                  					; never	would
 14267 000015A9 53                      		push	bx
 14268 000015AA BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14269 000015AD E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14270 000015B0 5B                      		pop	bx
 14271                                  int13b:					
 14272 000015B1 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14273 000015B2 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14274                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14275                                  
 14276                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14277                                  
 14278                                  goterr13:				
 14279 000015B4 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14280 000015B7 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14281                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14282 000015B9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14283 000015BC 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14284 000015BE 803E[3006]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14285 000015C3 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14286                                  
 14287 000015C5 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14288                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14289                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14290                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14291 000015CA 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14292                                  
 14293 000015CC 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14294                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14295                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14296 000015CE 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14297                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14298                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14299 000015D3 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14300 000015D6 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14301 000015D8 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14302 000015DA 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14303 000015DC 53                      		push	bx
 14304 000015DD 51                      		push	cx
 14305 000015DE 52                      		push	dx
 14306 000015DF A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14307                                  loop_ecc:				
 14308 000015E2 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14309                                  
 14310                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14311                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14312                                  ;
 14313                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14314                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14315                                  ; track.
 14316                                  ;
 14317                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14318                                  ; this request.
 14319                                  ;
 14320                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14321                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14322                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14323                                  ;
 14324 000015E5 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14325                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14326                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14327 000015E8 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14328                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14329 000015ED 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14330 000015EF 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14331 000015F2 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14332 000015F4 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14333 000015F7 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14334                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14335                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14336                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14337 000015F9 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14338                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14339                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14340                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14341                                  ok11_op:				
 14342 000015FB FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14343 000015FF 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14344 00001601 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14345                                  					; add 200h to address
 14346 00001603 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14347 00001605 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14348 00001607 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14349                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14350                                  
 14351                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14352                                  
 14353                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14354 00001609 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14355                                  ok11_exit:				
 14356 0000160A 5A                      		pop	dx
 14357 0000160B 59                      		pop	cx
 14358 0000160C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14359 0000160D EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14360                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14361                                  
 14362                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14363                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14364                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14365                                  
 14366                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14367 0000160F 06                      		push	es
 14368 00001610 53                      		push	bx
 14369 00001611 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14370 00001614 1E                      		push	ds
 14371 00001615 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14372 00001616 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14373                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14374                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14375 00001619 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14376                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14377 0000161E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14378 0000161F 07                      		pop	es
 14379 00001620 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14380 00001622 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14381 00001625 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14382                                  
 14383                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14384                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14385                                  
 14386                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14387 00001627 56                      		push	si
 14388 00001628 57                      		push	di
 14389 00001629 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14390 0000162B BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14391 0000162E E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14392 00001631 5F                      		pop	di
 14393 00001632 5E                      		pop	si
 14394 00001633 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14395                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14396                                  
 14397                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14398                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14399                                  
 14400                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14401 00001635 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14402 00001638 FB                      		sti
 14403 00001639 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14404 0000163C 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14405                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14406                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14407 0000163E 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14408 00001641 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14409 00001643 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14410 00001646 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14411 00001648 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14412                                  
 14413                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14414                                  
 14415                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14416                                  
 14417 0000164A 52                      		push	dx
 14418 0000164B 51                      		push	cx
 14419 0000164C 53                      		push	bx
 14420 0000164D 50                      		push	ax
 14421 0000164E 55                      		push	bp
 14422 0000164F 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14423 00001651 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14424 00001653 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14425 00001655 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14426 00001657 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14427 00001659 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14428 0000165B 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14429 0000165D 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14430                                  
 14431                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14432                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14433                                  
 14434 00001661 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14435 00001663 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14436                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14437                                  
 14438                                  no_skip_first:				
 14439 00001666 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14440 00001668 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14441 0000166A 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14442                                  
 14443                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14444                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14445                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14446                                  ;
 14447                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14448                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14449                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14450                                  ; in error.
 14451                                  
 14452 0000166C 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14453 0000166E 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14454                                  
 14455                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14456                                  
 14457 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14458                                  					; set up head number
 14459 00001673 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14460 00001676 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14461                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14462                                  
 14463                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14464 00001679 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14465 0000167B F9                      		stc
 14466 0000167C E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14467                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14468                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14469                                  
 14470                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14471                                  
 14472                                  intverify:				
 14473 0000167F 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14474 00001680 53                      		push	bx
 14475 00001681 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14476 00001682 07                      		pop	es
 14477                                  dosimple:				
 14478 00001683 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14479                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14480                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14481                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14482 00001686 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14483                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14484 0000168B 5B                      		pop	bx
 14485 0000168C 07                      		pop	es
 14486 0000168D E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14487                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14488                                  
 14489                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14490                                  
 14491                                  intformat:				
 14492 00001690 06                      		push	es
 14493 00001691 53                      		push	bx
 14494 00001692 56                      		push	si
 14495 00001693 57                      		push	di
 14496 00001694 1E                      		push	ds
 14497                                  
 14498                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14499                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14500                                  
 14501 00001695 06                      		push	es
 14502 00001696 1E                      		push	ds
 14503 00001697 07                      		pop	es
 14504 00001698 1F                      		pop	ds
 14505 00001699 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14506 0000169B BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14507 0000169E E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14508 000016A1 1F                      		pop	ds
 14509 000016A2 5F                      		pop	di
 14510 000016A3 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14511 000016A4 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14512                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14513                                  
 14514                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14515                                  ; the first block.
 14516                                  ;
 14517                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14518                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14519                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14520                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14521                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14522                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14523                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14524                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14525                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14526                                  
 14527                                  doblock:
 14528                                  
 14529                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14530                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14531                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14532                                  				
 14533 000016A6 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14534                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14535 000016A9 51                      		push	cx
 14536 000016AA 06                      		push	es
 14537 000016AB 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14538                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14539 000016AC E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14540 000016AF 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14541                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14542 000016B3 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14543                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14544 000016B8 5F                      		pop	di
 14545 000016B9 07                      		pop	es
 14546 000016BA 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14547 000016BC 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14548 000016BE B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14549 000016C0 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14550                                  doblockflop:				
 14551 000016C2 59                      		pop	cx
 14552                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14553 000016C3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14554 000016C5 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14555 000016C7 50                      		push	ax
 14556 000016C8 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14557 000016CA EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14558                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14559                                  
 14560                                  doblocklast:				
 14561 000016CC 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14562 000016CE 50                      		push	ax
 14563                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14564 000016CF E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14565 000016D2 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14566 000016D4 58                      		pop	ax
 14567 000016D5 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14568                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14569 000016D8 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14570 000016DA 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14571 000016DC 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14572 000016DE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14573 000016E0 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14574                                  					; then we are done already.
 14575 000016E2 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14576                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14577 000016E4 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14578 000016E7 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14579                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14580                                  
 14581                                  bufferx:				
 14582 000016E9 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14583                                  					; set up head number
 14584                                  buffer:					
 14585 000016EC 53                      		push	bx
 14586 000016ED 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14587 000016F0 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14588 000016F3 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14589                                  					
 14590                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14591                                  
 14592 000016F5 06                      		push	es
 14593 000016F6 1E                      		push	ds
 14594 000016F7 56                      		push	si
 14595 000016F8 57                      		push	di
 14596 000016F9 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14597 000016FA 06                      		push	es
 14598 000016FB 1F                      		pop	ds
 14599 000016FC 07                      		pop	es
 14600 000016FD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14601 00001700 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14602 00001701 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14603 00001703 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14604 00001706 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14605                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14606 00001707 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14607 00001708 5E                      		pop	si
 14608 00001709 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14609                                  
 14610                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14611                                  
 14612 0000170A B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14613                                  					; get drive number
 14614 0000170C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14615 0000170F E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14616                                  					;
 14617                                  					; ah is	function
 14618                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14619                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14620                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14621                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14622                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14623 00001712 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14624 00001715 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14625 00001716 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14626 00001718 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14627                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14628                                  
 14629                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14630                                  
 14631                                  doread:					
 14632 0000171A 06                      		push	es
 14633 0000171B 53                      		push	bx
 14634 0000171C 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14635 0000171D 07                      		pop	es
 14636 0000171E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14637 00001721 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14638 00001723 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14639                                  					; get drive number
 14640 00001726 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14641                                  					; ah = function
 14642                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14643                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14644                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14645 00001729 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14646 0000172C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14647 0000172D 07                      		pop	es
 14648 0000172E 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14649 00001730 56                      		push	si
 14650 00001731 57                      		push	di
 14651 00001732 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14652 00001734 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14653 00001737 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14654 0000173A 5F                      		pop	di
 14655 0000173B 5E                      		pop	si
 14656                                  
 14657                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14658                                  
 14659                                  dotail:					
 14660 0000173C 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14661 0000173D 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14662 00001740 41                      		inc	cx
 14663 00001741 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14664 00001744 F8                      		clc
 14665 00001745 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14666 00001747 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14667                                  
 14668                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14669                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14670                                  
 14671 00001749 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14672 0000174C E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14673 0000174F E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14674                                  
 14675                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14676                                  
 14677                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14678                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14679                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14680                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14681                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14682                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14683                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14684                                  
 14685                                  bad13:					
 14686 00001752 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14687 00001754 5D                      		pop	bp
 14688 00001755 5B                      		pop	bx
 14689 00001756 5B                      		pop	bx
 14690 00001757 59                      		pop	cx
 14691 00001758 5A                      		pop	dx
 14692 00001759 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14693 0000175B E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14694                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14695                                  
 14696                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14697 0000175E E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14698                                  
 14699                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14700                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14701                                  		;db 	0
 14702                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14703                                  
 14704                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14705

 14714                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14715 00001761 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14716 00001765 BF[7F06]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14717 00001768 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di

 14721                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14722                                  
 14723                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14724                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14725                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14726                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14727                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14728                                  
 14729                                  install_bds:
 14730 0000176D 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14731 0000176E BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14732                                  
 14733                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14734                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14735                                  loop_next_bds:
 14736 00001771 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14737                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14738 00001773 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14739 00001777 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14740                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14741 0000177A 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14742 0000177C B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14743 0000177E 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14744                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14745 00001782 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14746 00001785 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14747                                  					; we don't own it
 14748 0000178A 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14749                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14750 0000178D 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14751 00001790 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14752                                  next_bds:
 14753                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14754 00001794 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14755 00001797 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14756                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14757                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14758 00001799 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14759 0000179B 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14760                                  					; install bds
 14761 0000179E 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14762 000017A0 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14763                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14764                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14765 000017A3 1F                      		pop	ds
 14766                                  
 14767                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)

 14770                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14771                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14772                                  
 14773                                  		; 01/06/2019
 14774 000017A4 268A4534                		mov	al,[es:di+52]

 14779 000017AE A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot],al
 14780                                  _eot_ok:
 14781 000017B1 C3                      		retn

 14801 000017B2 F606[6F08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1

 14803 000017B7 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus

 14822 000017C9 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
