 20373                                  
 20374                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20375                                  ;
 20376                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20377                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20378                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20379                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20380                                  ;
 20381                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20382                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20383                                  ;
 20384                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20385                                  
 20386                                  StartVDHead:
 20387                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20388                                  
 20389 00000AD8 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20390 00000ADC 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20391 00000ADE 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20392 00000AE0 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20393 00000AE2 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20394                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20395 00000AE3 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20396                                  VDiskSig1:
 20397 00000AEA 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20398                                  
 20399                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20400                                  
 20401 00000AEF 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20402                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20403 00000AF5 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20404 00000B04 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20405 00000B06 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20406                                  VDInt19:
 20407 00000B07 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20408                                  OldVDInt19:
 20409 00000B08 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20410                                  
 20411                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20412                                  
 20413                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20414 00000B0C 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20415                                  VDiskSig2:
 20416 00000B0F 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20417                                  
 20418                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20419                                  
 20420 00000B14 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20421 00000B17 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20422 00000B19 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20423 00000B1A 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20424 00000B1C 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20425 00000B1D 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20426 00000B1F 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20427 00000B21 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20428 00000B22 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20429 00000B24 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20430 00000B26 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20431 00000B28 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20432 00000B2A 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20433                                  
 20434                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 20435                                  
 20436                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20437                                  ;
 20438                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20439                                  ;
 20440                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20441                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20442                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20443                                  ;
 20444                                  ; Inputs : None
 20445                                  ;
 20446                                  ; Outputs : None
 20447                                  ;
 20448                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20449                                  ;
 20450                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20451                                  
 20452                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20453                                  
 20454                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20455 00000B2C 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20456 00000B2E 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20457                                  
 20458                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20459                                  
 20460                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20461 00000B30 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20462                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20463 00000B33 2EA3[080B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20464 00000B37 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20465                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20466 00000B3A 2EA3[0A0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20467                                  
 20468                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20469                                  
 20470 00000B3E B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20471                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20472                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20473 00000B40 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20474 00000B43 CD21                    	int	21h
 20475                                  
 20476                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20477                                  
 20478 00000B45 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20479 00000B46 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20480                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20481 00000B48 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20482                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20483 00000B4F 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20484 00000B56 40                      	inc	ax
 20485 00000B57 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20486                                  
 20487                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20488                                  
 20489 00000B59 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20490                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20491 00000B5A C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20492 00000B60 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20493                                  
 20494                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20495                                  
 20496                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20497 00000B63 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20498 00000B66 BE[D80A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20499 00000B69 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20500 00000B6B 0E                      	push	cs
 20501 00000B6C 1F                      	pop	ds
 20502 00000B6D FC                      	cld
 20503 00000B6E F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20504 00000B70 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20505                                  
 20506                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20507                                  
 20508                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20509 00000B71 57                      	push	di
 20510 00000B72 06                      	push	es
 20511                                  
 20512                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20513                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20514                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20515 00000B73 49                      	dec	cx
 20516                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20517 00000B74 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20518                                  
 20519 00000B76 BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20520                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20521 00000B79 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20522 00000B7C BE[0C0B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20523 00000B7F F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20524                                  
 20525 00000B81 5F                      	pop	di
 20526 00000B82 07                      	pop	es
 20527                                  
 20528 00000B83 C3                      	retn
 20529                                  
 20530                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20531                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 20532                                  ;
 20533                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 20534                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 20535                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 20536                                  ;
 20537                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20538                                  
 20539                                  struc desc
 20540 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 20541 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 20542 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 20543 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 20544 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 20545                                   .size:
 20546                                  endstruc
 20547                                  
 20548                                  		; 23/10/2022
 20549                                  bmove:		;label byte
 20550                                  
 20551                                  dummy:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 20552 00000B84 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0		 
 20553                                  gdt:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 20554 00000B8C 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20555 00000B94 FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 20556 00000B96 0000                    		dw	0
 20557 00000B98 00                      		db	0
 20558 00000B99 93                      		db	93h
 20559 00000B9A 0000                    		dw	0
 20560 00000B9C FFFF                    tgt_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,10h,93h,0>  ; 1MB
 20561 00000B9E 0000                    		dw	0
 20562 00000BA0 10                      		db	10h
 20563 00000BA1 93                      		db	93h
 20564 00000BA2 0000                    		dw	0
 20565

 20567 00000BA4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20568                                  temp_stack:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 20569 00000BAC 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20570                                  
 20571 00000BB4 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 20572                                  
 20573                                  
 20574                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20575                                  
 20576                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20577                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20578                                  
 20579                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20580                                  
 20581                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20582                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20583                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20584                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20585                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20586                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20587                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20588                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20589                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20590                                  ;								      ;I070
 20591                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20592                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20593                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20594                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20595                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20596                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20597                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20598                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20599                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20600                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20601                                  ;								      ;I070
 20602                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20603                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20604                                  
 20605                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20606                                  	; ds = cs
 20607                                  
 20608                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20609                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20610                                  
 20611 00000BD4 06                      	push	es
 20612 00000BD5 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20613 00000BD7 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20614 00000BD9 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20615 00000BDB D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20616 00000BDD B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20617 00000BDF D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20618 00000BE1 05[B40B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20619 00000BE4 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20620                                  
 20621                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20622                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20623                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20624                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20625                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 20626                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20627                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20628 00000BE7 A3[960B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 20629                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20630 00000BEA 8816[980B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20631                                  
 20632 00000BEE B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 20633 00000BF1 0E                      	push	cs
 20634 00000BF2 07                      	pop	es
 20635 00000BF3 BE[840B]                	mov	si,bmove
 20636 00000BF6 B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 20637 00000BF8 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 20638                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 20639                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 20640                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 20641 00000BFA 07                      	pop	es
 20642 00000BFB C3                      	retn

 20646                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20647                                  ;
 20648                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20649                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20650                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20651                                  ;		the offset.
 20652                                  ;

 20655                                  ;

 20659                                  	; 03/09/2023

 20663                                  	;
 20664 00000C02 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20665 00000C04 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 20666                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20667 00000C07 A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 20668                                  	;
 20669 00000C0A 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20670 00000C0C 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20671 00000C0F 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20672 00000C12 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20673 00000C14 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20674 00000C16 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20675                                  	;
 20676                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20677                                  	;push	ds
 20678                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20679                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20680                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20681                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20682                                  	;mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20683                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 20684 00000C18 893E[9608]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20685                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20686 00000C1C 1F                      	pop	ds
 20687 00000C1D C3                      	retn

 20729                                  ;
 20730                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20731                                  ;
 20732                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20733                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20734                                  ;
 20735                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20736                                  
 20737                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20738                                  CPMHack:
 20739 00000C45 1E                      	push	ds
 20740 00000C46 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20741 00000C49 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20742                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20743                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20744 00000C4B 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20745 00000C4C 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20746 00000C4E BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20747 00000C51 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20748                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20749 00000C54 B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20750 00000C56 FC                      	cld
 20751 00000C57 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20752 00000C59 1F                      	pop	ds
 20753 00000C5A C3                      	retn

 21654                                  
 21655                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21656                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21657                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21658                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21659                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21660                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21661                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21662                                  ;
 21663                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21664                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21665                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21666                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21667                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21668                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21669                                  ;
 21670                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21671                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21672                                  ;
 21673                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21674                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21675                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21676                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21677                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21678                                  ;
 21679                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21680                                  ;
 21681                                  ;			  none.
 21682                                  
 21683                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21684                                  ;
 21685                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21686                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21687                                  
 21688                                  	; 24/10/2022

 22063                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22064                                  
 22065                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22066                                  ;
 22067                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22068                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22069                                  ;
 22070                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22071                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22072                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22073                                  
 22074                                  ParaRound:
 22075 00001153 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22076 00001156 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22077 00001158 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22078 0000115A D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22079 0000115C D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22080 0000115E C3                      	retn
 22081                                  
 22082                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22083                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22084                                  ;
 22085                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22086                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22087                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22088                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22089                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22090                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22091                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22092                                  ;
 22093                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22094                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22095                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22096                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22097                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22098                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22099                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22100                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22101                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22102                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22103                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22104                                  ;
 22105                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22106                                  
 22107                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22108                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22109                                  sysinit_base:				
 22110 0000115F 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22111 00001164 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22112 00001169 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22113 0000116B 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22114 00001170 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22115 00001175 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22116 00001176 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22117 00001177 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22118                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22119                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22120 00001179 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22121 0000117C 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22122 00001181 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22123                                  
 22124                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22125                                  
 22126 00001183 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22127 00001185 0E                      	push	cs
 22128 00001186 1F                      	pop	ds
 22129                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22130                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22131                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22132 00001187 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22133                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22134 0000118A CD21                    	int	21h
 22135                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22136                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22137                                  
 22138                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22139                                  stall:
 22140                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22141                                  _stall: 
 22142                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22143 0000118C F4                      	hlt 
 22144                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22145                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22146 0000118D EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22147                                  
 22148                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22149 0000118F 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22150                                  
 22151                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22152                                  
 22153                                  sum_up:
 22154                                  
 22155                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22156                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22157                                  ;
 22158                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22159                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22160                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22161                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22162                                  ;
 22163                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22164                                  
 22165 00001194 1E                      	push	ds
 22166                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22167                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22168 00001195 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22169                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22170                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22171 00001199 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22172 0000119B 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22173 0000119D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22174 0000119F 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22175                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22176 000011A4 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22177 000011A6 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22178                                  sum1:
 22179 000011A8 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22180 000011AA 46                      	inc	si
 22181 000011AB 46                      	inc	si
 22182 000011AC E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22183                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22184                                  sum_sys_code:
 22185                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22186 000011AE BEAE11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22187                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22188                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22189                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22190                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22191                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22192                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22193                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22194 000011B1 B9[804D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22195 000011B4 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22196 000011B6 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22197                                  sum2:
 22198 000011B8 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22199 000011BB 46                      	inc	si
 22200 000011BC 46                      	inc	si
 22201 000011BD E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22202 000011BF 1F                      	pop	ds
 22203 000011C0 C3                      	retn
 22204                                  
 22205                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22206                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22207                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22208                                  
 22209                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22210                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22211 000011C1 0000                    	dw	0
 22212                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22213                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 22214 000011C3 0000                    	dw	0	
 22215                                  
 22216                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 22217                                  
 22218                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 22219                                  
 22220                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6:  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:12F6h
 22221 000011C5 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 22222 000011C7 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 22222 000011D0 6C6F636174696F6E20-
 22222 000011D9 6572726F722024     
 22223                                  
 22224                                  end_sysinit_base: ; label byte
 22225                                  	; 24/10/2022

 22228                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22229                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22230                                  ;
 22231                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22232                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22233                                  ;
 22234                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22235                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22236                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22237                                  ;
 22238                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22239                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22240                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22241                                  
 22242                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22243                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 22244                                  
 22245                                  set_buffer:
 22246 000011E0 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 22247 000011E2 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 22248 000011E5 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 22249 000011E7 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 22250                                  set_buff_1:
 22251                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22252                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 22253 000011E9 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 22254                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 22255 000011EB 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 22256                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 22257 000011EE C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 22258                                  
 22259 000011F3 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 22260 000011F5 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 22261 000011FA 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 22262                                  
 22263                                  ;	for each buffer
 22264                                  
 22265                                  nxt_buff:
 22266 000011FB E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 22267 000011FE 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 22268 00001200 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 22269                                  
 22270 00001202 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22271                                  
 22272 00001207 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 22273                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22274 00001208 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22275 0000120B 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22276                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 22277                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22278 0000120D 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 22279                                  
 22280 00001211 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 22281 00001213 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 22282                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 22283 00001215 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 22284 00001219 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 22285                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 22286 0000121D C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 22287                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 22288 00001222 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 22289 00001225 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 22290                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 22291                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 22292 00001229 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22293                                  set_buff_2:
 22294 0000122C 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 22295                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 22296 00001231 2E800E[C514]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 22297                                  	;call	round
 22298                                  	;retn
 22299                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22300 00001237 E94630                  	jmp	round
 22301                                  
 22302                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22303                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22304                                  ;
 22305                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22306                                  ;
 22307                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22308                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22309                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22310                                  
 22311                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22312                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22313 0000123A 53                      	push	bx
 22314 0000123B 52                      	push	dx
 22315 0000123C 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22316 00001240 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22317                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22318 00001245 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22319                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22320                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22321                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22322 00001248 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22323 0000124A 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22324 0000124C B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22325                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22326 0000124F CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22327 00001251 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22328 00001254 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22329                                  	
 22330                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22331                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22332                                  	; zf=1
 22333 00001256 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22334                                  	; zf=1
 22335                                  	
 22336                                  	;zf=1
 22337                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22338                                  	;zf=1
 22339 00001257 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22340                                  got_hma:
 22341 0000125C 5A                      	pop	dx
 22342 0000125D 5B                      	pop	bx
 22343 0000125E C3                      	retn
 22344

 22347                                  set_buffer_info:
 22348                                  
 22349                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 22350                                  ;
 22351                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 22352                                  ;    ax = di
 22353                                  ;
 22354                                  ;out:
 22355                                  ;    above entries set.
 22356                                  
 22357                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22358 0000125F 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]

 22360 00001264 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 22361 00001268 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 22362 0000126C 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 22363                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 22364 00001271 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax

 22366 00001274 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22367                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22368 0000127A 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22369                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22370 00001280 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22371 00001286 C3                      	retn
 22372                                  
 22373                                  ; ======================================================================
 22374                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22375                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22376                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22377                                  
 22378                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22379                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22380                                  ;
 22381                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22382                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22383                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22384                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22385                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22386                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22387                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22388                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22389                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22390                                  ;
 22391                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22392                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22393                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22394                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22395                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22396                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22397                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22398                                  ;	conditions:
 22399                                  ;
 22400                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22401                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22402                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22403                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22404                                  ;
 22405                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22406                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22407                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22408                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22409                                  ;
 22410                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22411                                  ;
 22412                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22413                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22414                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22415                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22416                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22417                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22418                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22419                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22420                                  ;
 22421                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22422                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22423                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22424                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22425                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22426                                  ;
 22427                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22428                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22429                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22430                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22431                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22432                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22433                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22434                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22435                                  ;
 22436                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22437                                  
 22438                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22439                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22440                                  
 22441                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22442                                  stackinit:
 22443 00001287 50                      	push	ax
 22444 00001288 1E                      	push	ds
 22445 00001289 06                      	push	es
 22446 0000128A 53                      	push	bx
 22447 0000128B 51                      	push	cx
 22448 0000128C 52                      	push	dx
 22449 0000128D 57                      	push	di
 22450 0000128E 56                      	push	si
 22451 0000128F 55                      	push	bp
 22452                                  
 22453                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22454                                  
 22455                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22456                                  	; ds = cs
 22457 00001290 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22458 00001293 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22459                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22460                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22461                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22462 00001295 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22463                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22464 00001299 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22465 0000129C 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22466                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22467 000012A0 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22468                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22469                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22470                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22471 000012A3 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22472                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22473 000012A7 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22474 000012A9 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22475                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22476                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22477                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22478 000012AC 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22479                                  
 22480                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22481                                  
 22482                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22483                                  
 22484                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22485                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22486                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22487 000012B0 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22488                                  
 22489                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22490                                  
 22491 000012B5 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22492                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22493                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22494                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22495 000012B8 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22496 000012BA 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22497 000012BC 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22498 000012C0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22499 000012C2 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22500                                  
 22501                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22502                                  
 22503 000012C5 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22504 000012CA 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22505 000012CE F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22506 000012D0 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22507 000012D2 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22508 000012D4 06                      	push	es
 22509 000012D5 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22510                                  
 22511                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22512                                  
 22513 000012D6 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22514 000012DA FC                      	cld
 22515 000012DB F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22516                                  
 22517 000012DD 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22518                                  
 22519                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22520                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22521                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22522                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22523                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22524                                  
 22525                                  buildloop:
 22526                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22527                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22528                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22529                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 22530                                  	; 06/07/2023
 22531 000012E1 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free
 22532 000012E5 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 22533                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 22534 000012E9 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax

 23280                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23281                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23282                                  
 23283                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23284                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23285                                  
 23286                                  new_init_loop:
 23287                                  
 23288                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23289                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23290                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23291                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23292                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23293                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23294                                  
 23295 00001479 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23296 0000147C 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23297 0000147E 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23298 00001482 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23299                                  
 23300 00001485 1E                      	push	ds
 23301                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23302                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23303                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23304 00001486 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23305 00001489 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23306 0000148B 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23307 0000148E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23308 00001490 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23309 00001494 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23310 00001497 1F                      	pop	ds
 23311                                  
 23312 00001498 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23313 0000149B 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23314 0000149F C3                      	retn
 23315                                  
 23316                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 23605                                  ;
 23606                                  ;
 23607                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23608                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23609                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23610                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23611                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23612                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23613                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23614                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23615                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23616                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23617                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23618                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23619                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23620                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23621                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23622                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23623                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23624                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23625                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23626                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23627                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23628                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23629                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23630                                  ;	   :
 23631                                  ;
 23632                                  ;Note:
 23633                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23634                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23635                                  ;
 23636                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23637                                  ;
 23638                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23639                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23640                                  ;
 23641                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23642                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23643                                  ;
 23644                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23645                                  ;
 23646                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23647                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23648                                  ;
 23649                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23650                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23651                                  ;
 23652                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23653                                  ;
 23654                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23655                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23656                                  ;
 23657                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23658                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23659                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23660                                  ;
 23661                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23662                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23663                                  ;
 23664                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23665                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23666                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23667                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23668                                  
 23669                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23670                                  
 23671                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23672                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23673                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23674                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23675                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23676                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23677                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23678                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23679                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23680                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23681                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23682                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23683                                  
 23684                                  ;**** Function flags
 23685                                  
 23686                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23687                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23688                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23689                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23690                                  
 23691                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23692                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23693 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23694 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23695 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23696 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23697 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23698 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23699                                  endstruc
 23700                                  
 23701                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23702                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23703                                  ;
 23704                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23705                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23706                                  ;	     +-
 23707                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23708                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23709                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23710                                  ;	     |	:
 23711                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23712                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23713                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23714                                  ;	     |	:
 23715                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23716                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23717                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23718                                  ;	     +-	:
 23719                                  ;
 23720                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23721                                  ;
 23722                                  ;Note:
 23723                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23724                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23725                                  ;
 23726                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23727                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23728                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23729                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23730                                  
 23731                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23732                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23733                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23734                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23735                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23736                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23737                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23738                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23739                                  
 23740                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23741 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23742 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23743 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23744 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23745 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23746                                  endstruc
 23747                                  
 23748                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23749                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23750                                  ;
 23751                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23752                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23753                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23754                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23755                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23756                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23757                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23758                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23759                                  ;
 23760                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23761                                  ;
 23762                                  ;            +-
 23763                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23764                                  ;	    | or
 23765                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23766                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23767                                  ;	    | or
 23768                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23769                                  ;	    | or
 23770                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23771                                  ;	    | or
 23772                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23773                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23774                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23775                                  ;	    | or
 23776                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23777                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23778                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23779                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23780                                  ;	    +-
 23781                                  ;
 23782                                  ;
 23783                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23784                                  ;      list.
 23785                                  ;
 23786                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23787                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23788                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23789                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23790

 23795 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23796 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23797                                  endstruc

 23826                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23827                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23828                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23910                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 23912                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
