 23914                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23915                                  ; SysParse;
 23916                                  ;
 23917                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23918                                  ;
 23919                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23920                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23921                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23922                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23923                                  ;
 23924                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23925                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23926                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23927                                  ;
 23928                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23929                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23930                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23931                                  ;
 23932                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23933                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23934                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23935                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23936                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23937                                  ;
 23938                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23939                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23940                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23941                                  ;
 23942                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23943                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23944                                  ;
 23945                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23946                                  ;
 23947                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23948                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23949                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23950                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23951                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23952                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23953                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23954                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23955                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23956                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23957                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23958                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23959                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23960                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23961                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23962                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23963                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23964                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23965                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23966                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23967                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23968                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23969                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23970                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23971                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23972                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23973                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23974                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23975                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23976                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23977                                  
 23978                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23979                                  
 23980                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23981                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23982                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23983                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23984                                  
 23985                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23986                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23987                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23988                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23989                                  ;
 23990                                  
 23991                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23992                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23993                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23994                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23995                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23996                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23997                                  
 23998                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23999                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24000                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24001                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24002                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24003                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24004                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24005                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24006                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24007                                  
 24008                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24009                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24010                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24011                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24012                                  ;	     segment.
 24013                                  
 24014                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24015                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24016                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020

 24611                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24612                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24613                                  ;
 24614                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24615                                  ;
 24616                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24617                                  ;	    AL = type
 24618                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24619                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24620                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24621                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24622                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24623                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24624                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24625                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24626                                  ;
 24627                                  ; Output:   None
 24628                                  ;
 24629                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24630                                  ;
 24631                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24632                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24633                                  
 24634                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24635 00001783 57                      	push	di			;AN000;

 24644                                  
 24645 00001790 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24646 00001791 2EA1[E014]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM] ;AC034; if yes,
 24647 00001795 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 24648                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 24649 00001799 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24650                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 24651 0000179A 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number

 24723                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24724                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 24725                                  ;
 24726                                  ; Function:  Check the mutch_flags and make the exit code and set the
 24727                                  ;	     result buffer
 24728                                  ;
 24729                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 24730                                  ;		Complex
 24731                                  ;		Date
 24732                                  ;		Time
 24733                                  ;		Drive
 24734                                  ;		Filespec
 24735                                  ;		Quoted String
 24736                                  ;		Simple String
 24737                                  ;
 24738                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24739                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24740                                  ;
 24741                                  ; Output:    None
 24742                                  ;
 24743                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format
 24744                                  ;	     _$P_Time_Format, _$P_Complex_Format, _$P_File_Foemat
 24745                                  ;	     _$P_Drive_Format
 24746                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24747                                  
 24748                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24749                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:19CFh)

 24753 00001804 2EC606[7015]00          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_err_flag],_$P_NULL

 24756                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Match_Flag]
 24757 0000180B 268B07                  	mov	ax,[es:bx]		;AN000; load match flag(16bit) to ax

 24763 00001815 57                      	push	di			;AN000; (tm12)

 25028                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25029                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25030                                  ;
 25031                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25032                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25033                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25034                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25035                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25036                                  ;
 25037                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25038                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25039                                  ;
 25040                                  ; Output:    None
 25041                                  ;
 25042                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25043                                  ;
 25044                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25045                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25046                                  
 25047                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25048                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25049                                  
 25050                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25051                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25052                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25053 00001936 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25054 00001937 2E800E[D914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25055 0000193D 2E8026[D914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25056                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25057 00001943 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25058 00001946 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25059 00001948 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25060                                  
 25061 0000194A 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25062 0000194C 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25063                                  
 25064 0000194E 2E800E[D914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25065                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25066 00001954 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25067                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25068 00001955 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25069 00001958 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25070 00001959 C3                      	retn
 25071                                  
 25072                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25073                                  
 25074                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25075                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 25076                                  
 25077                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25078                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 25079 0000195A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25080 0000195B 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25081 0000195C 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25082 0000195D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25083 0000195E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 25084 00001960 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 25085 00001962 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 25086                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 25087 00001963 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25088 00001966 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 25089 00001968 743C                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 25090                                  
 25091 0000196A E8E000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 25092 0000196D 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 25093                                  
 25094 0000196F 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 25095 00001971 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 25096                                  
 25097                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25098                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 25099                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 25100                                  %if 0
 25101                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 25102                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25103                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25104                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25105                                  
 25106                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 25107                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 25108                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 25109                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25110                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25111                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25112                                  
 25113                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 25114                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25115                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25116                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25117                                  
 25118                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 25119                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 25120                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25121                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25122                                  
 25123                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 25124                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 25125                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25126                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25127                                  
 25128                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 25129                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25130                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 25131                                  %endif
 25132                                  ;****
 25133                                  %if 1
 25134                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25135                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2130h)
 25136                                  
 25137 00001973 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 25138 00001975 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; save binary number
 25139 00001977 E81C00                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 25140 0000197A 89D3                    	mov	bx,dx			; ax:bx = 2*(cx:dx)
 25141 0000197C 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 25142 0000197E E81500                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 25143 00001981 E81200                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 25144 00001984 01DA                    	add	dx,bx			; 8*(cx:dx)+2*(cx:dx) = 10*(cx:dx)
 25145 00001986 11C1                    	adc	cx,ax
 25146 00001988 E80F00                  	call	_$P_Value_Chk_Add_OVF
 25147 0000198B 01EA                    	add	dx,bp			; Add the current one degree decimal

 25333                                  ;
 25334                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25335                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25336                                  ;
 25337                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25338                                  ;
 25339                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25340                                  ;

 25343

 25345                                  _$P_Check_OVF:

 25347 00001A3C 2EF606[D914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25348 00001A42 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25349                                  
 25350 00001A44 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25351 00001A45 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25352                                  
 25353                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25354 00001A46 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25355 00001A47 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25356                                  
 25357 00001A49 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25358 00001A4A C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25359                                  
 25360                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25361 00001A4B F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25362 00001A4C C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25914                                  
 25915                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_NCY:			;AN000;
 25916 00001C44 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate non delim
 25917                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit:			;AN000; in this case, need
 25918 00001C45 4E                      	dec	si			;AN000;  backup index pointer
 25919                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25920                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25921                                  ;_$P_Exit_At_Extra:	 ; cf=0
 25922 00001C46 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25923                                  
 25924                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25925                                  ;_$P_Exit_At_Extra:			;AN000;
 25926                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate extra delim
 25927                                  	;retn				;AN000;

 25929                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25930                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 25931                                  ;
 25932                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 25933                                  ;
 25934                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25935                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25936                                  ;
 25937                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 25938                                  ;**********************************************************************
 25939                                  
 25940                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 25941 00001C47 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25942 00001C48 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25943 00001C49 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 25944 00001C4B 742C                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25945 00001C4D 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 25946 00001C4F 7428                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25947                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 25948 00001C51 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 25949 00001C53 7424                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25950                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 25951 00001C55 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 25952                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 25953 00001C5A 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25954 00001C5C 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 25955 00001C5E 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 25956                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25957 00001C62 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 25958                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25959 00001C65 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; *
 25960 00001C67 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 25961 00001C6B 740B                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 25962                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25963                                  	;;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 25964                                  	;xor	ch,ch ; *
 25965 00001C6D 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; 
 25966                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 25967 00001C70 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25968 00001C71 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 25969 00001C74 7403                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25970 00001C76 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 25971                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25972                                  	; cx=0
 25973                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 25974                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 25975                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25976 00001C78 41                      	inc	cx  ; zf=0  (cx=1) ; *
 25977                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 25978 00001C79 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25979 00001C7A 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25980 00001C7B C3                      	retn

 25982                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25983                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25984                                  ;
 25985                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25986                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25987                                  ;	    blanks.
 25988                                  ;
 25989                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25990                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25991                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25992                                  ;
 25993                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25994                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25995                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25996                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25997                                  
 25998                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25999                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26000                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26001                                  
 26002                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26003 00001C7C 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26004 00001C7D 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26005 00001C7E 2EC606[D314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26006                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26007                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26008 00001C84 2E8026[D914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26009 00001C8A 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26010 00001C8C 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26011                                  
 26012 00001C8E 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26013 00001C90 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26014                                  
 26015 00001C92 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26016 00001C94 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26017                                  
 26018                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26019                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26020                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26021                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26022                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26023                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26024                                  %if 0
 26025                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26026                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26027                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26028                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26029                                  
 26030                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26031                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26032                                  
 26033                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26034                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26035                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26036                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26037                                  %endif
 26038                                  
 26039                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26040 00001C96 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26041                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26042 00001C9B 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26043                                  
 26044                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26045 00001C9D 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26046                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26047 00001C9F 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26048                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26049                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26050                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26051                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26052 00001CA3 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26053                                  
 26054 00001CA5 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26055                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26056 00001CA8 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26057 00001CA9 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 26058 00001CAC 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26059                                  
 26060 00001CAE E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 26061                                  
 26062                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 26063                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 26064                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26065                                  	; cx=0 here
 26066 00001CB0 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26067                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26068                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 26069 00001CB1 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26070 00001CB2 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26071 00001CB3 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26072                                  
 26073                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 26074 00001CB4 2EA2[D314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 26075 00001CB8 2EF606[D914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 26076 00001CBE 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 26077                                  
 26078 00001CC0 2E800E[D914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 26079                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 26080                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 26081 00001CC6 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 26082 00001CC8 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 26084                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26085                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26086                                  ;
 26087                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26088                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26089                                  ;
 26090                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26091                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26092                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26093                                  ;
 26094                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26095                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26096                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26097                                  
 26098                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26099                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26100                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26101                                  ;
 26102                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26103                                  
 26104                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26105                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26106                                  
 26107                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26108                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26109                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26110                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26111 00001CCA BD[E214]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26112                                  
 26113                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26114 00001CCD 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26115 00001CCF 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26116                                  
 26117                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26118 00001CD1 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26119 00001CD3 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26120                                  
 26121 00001CD5 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26122                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26123                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26124 00001CD6 C3                      	retn
 26125                                  
 26126                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26127                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26128                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26129                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26130                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26131                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26132                                  
 26133                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26134                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26135 00001CD7 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26136 00001CD9 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26137                                  
 26138 00001CDB 2E800E[D914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26139                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26140                                  
 26141                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26142                                  	; cf=0
 26143                                  	;retn
 26144                                  
 26145                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26146                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26147                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26148 00001CE1 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26149                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26150                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26151 00001CE2 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26152                                  
 26153                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26154                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26155                                  ;
 26156                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26157                                  ;
 26158                                  ;  Input:
 26159                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26160                                  ;
 26161                                  ;  Output:
 26162                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26163                                  ;
 26164                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26165                                  ;
 26166                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26167                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26168                                  
 26169                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26170 00001CE3 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26171 00001CE4 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26172 00001CE5 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26173                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 26174                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 26175                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26176 00001CE6 2E8B36[D614]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26177 00001CEB 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26178 00001CED 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26179 00001CEF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26180 00001CF0 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26181 00001CF1 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26182 00001CF2 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26183 00001CF3 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26184 00001CF4 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26185 00001CF5 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26186                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26187                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26188 00001CF6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26189 00001CF8 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26190 00001CFB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26191                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26192 00001CFD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26193 00001CFF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26194 00001D01 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26195 00001D02 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26196 00001D03 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26197 00001D04 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26198 00001D05 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26199 00001D06 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26200 00001D07 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26201 00001D08 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26202                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26203 00001D0A 2E8936[D414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26204 00001D0F 2E891E[D614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26205                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26206                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26207                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26208                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26209 00001D14 2EC536[D414]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26210                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26211 00001D19 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26212 00001D1C 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26213 00001D1E 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26214 00001D20 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26215 00001D22 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26216 00001D25 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26217 00001D27 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26218 00001D28 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26219                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 26220 00001D2A 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 26221 00001D2B 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26222                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26223 00001D2C EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26224                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 26225                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26226                                  	; cf=0
 26227                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26228                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 26229 00001D2E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26230 00001D2F 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 26231 00001D30 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 26232 00001D31 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26813                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26814                                  ;
 26815                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26816                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26817                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26818                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26819                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26820                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26821                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26822                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26823                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26824                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26825                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26826                                  ;
 26827                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26828                                  
 26829                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26830                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26831                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26832                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26833                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26834                                  
 26835                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26836                                  
 26837                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26838                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26839                                  
 26840                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26841                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26842                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26843                                  
 26844                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26845                                  ;
 26846                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26847                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26848                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26849                                  ;	           line.
 26850                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26851                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26852                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26853                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26854                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26855                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26856                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26857                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26858                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26859                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26860                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26861                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26862                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26863                                  ;	           for details).
 26864                                  
 26865 00001F31 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 26866 00001F32 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 26867 00001F33 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 26868 00001F35 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 26869 00001F36 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26870 00001F46 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26871 00001F66 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 26872 00001F67 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 26873 00001F68 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 26874                                  
 26875                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26876                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26877                                  
 26878                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26879                                  
 26880                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022

 26892 00001F69 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 26893 00001F6B 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26894 00001F6D 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26895 00001F6F 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26896 00001F73 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26897                                  ; 30/12/2022
 26898                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26899 00001F77 00                      ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 26900                                  ;
 26901 00001F78 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 26902 00001F79 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 26903 00001F7B 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26904 00001F7D 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 26905                                  ;
 26906 00001F7F 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 26907                                  ;
 26908 00001F83 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 26909 00001F85 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 26910                                  ;
 26911 00001F87 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 26912                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 26913 00001F88 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 26914                                  ;
 26915 00001F8A 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 26916 00001F8B 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 26917 00001F8D 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 26918                                  ;
 26919 00001F95 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 26920 00001F96 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data
 26921 00001F98 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 26922 00001F9C 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 26923                                  				; to use the file name in the command line

 26946                                  doconf:
 26947 00001F9D 0E                      	push	cs
 26948 00001F9E 1F                      	pop	ds
 26949                                  
 26950 00001F9F B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 26951                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 26952 00001FA2 CD21                    	int	21h
 26953 00001FA4 8816[4B46]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 26954                                  
 26955                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 26956                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26957                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26958                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 26959 00001FA8 8816[4946]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 26960                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26961                                  
 26962 00001FAC BA[6045]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 26963 00001FAF B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 26964                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 26965 00001FB2 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26966 00001FB3 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26967 00001FB5 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 26968                                  
 26969                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26970                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26971                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26972 00001FB7 E8F918                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 26973                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 26974                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 26975 00001FBA C606[CD02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 26976 00001FBF C3                      	retn
 26977                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 26978 00001FC0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 26979 00001FC2 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; 0
 26980 00001FC4 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; 0
 26981                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 26982 00001FC6 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 26983 00001FC9 CD21                    	int	21h
 26984 00001FCB A3[5603]                	mov	[count],ax		; dx:ax = file size ; 08/09/2023
 26985                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 26986 00001FCE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 26987                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 26988                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.
 26989                                  					; ((Also PCDOS 7.1 has 'xor dx,dx' here))
 26990                                  					; (Error will be same if CONGIG.SYS file
 26991                                  					;  size > 64KB) 
 26992                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 26993 00001FD0 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 26994 00001FD3 CD21                    	int	21h
 26995                                  
 26996                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 26997 00001FD5 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 26998                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26999                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 27000                                  
 27001 00001FD9 A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 27002 00001FDC A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27003 00001FDF E871F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27004 00001FE2 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27005                                  
 27006                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27007                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27008                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27009                                  ;
 27010                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27011                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27012                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27013                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27014                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27015                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27016                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27017                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27018                                  ;
 27019 00001FE4 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27020 00001FE5 8916[BE14]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27021 00001FE9 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27022                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27023                                  
 27024 00001FEB 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 27025                                  	
 27026                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27027 00001FEE 8916[A502]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27028 00001FF2 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27029                                  	
 27030                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27031                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27032                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 27033                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27034                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27035                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27036                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 27037                                  
 27038                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27039                                  	; ds = cs
 27040 00001FF6 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 27041                                  	
 27042 00001FFA 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27043 00001FFC 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27044                                  
 27045 00001FFE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27046                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27047                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27048 00002000 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27049                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27050 00002002 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27051 00002003 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27052 00002005 9C                      	pushf
 27053                                  
 27054                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27055                                  
 27056 00002006 50                      	push	ax
 27057 00002007 57                      	push	di
 27058 00002008 51                      	push	cx
 27059 00002009 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27060 0000200B 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27061 0000200D E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27062 0000200F F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27063 00002011 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27064                                  
 27065                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27066                                  
 27067 00002013 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27068                                  
 27069                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27070                                  
 27071                                  puteol:
 27072 00002014 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27073 00002016 AA                      	stosb
 27074 00002017 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27075 00002019 AA                      	stosb
 27076 0000201A 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27077                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27078                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27079                                  
 27080                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27081                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27082 0000201C 0E                      	push	cs
 27083 0000201D 1F                      	pop	ds
 27084                                  
 27085 0000201E 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 27086                                  
 27087 00002022 59                      	pop	cx
 27088 00002023 5F                      	pop	di
 27089 00002024 58                      	pop	ax
 27090                                  
 27091                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27092                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27093                                  	;push	cs
 27094                                  	;pop	ds
 27095                                  
 27096 00002025 50                      	push	ax
 27097                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 27098 00002026 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 27099 00002028 CD21                    	int	21h
 27100 0000202A 58                      	pop	ax
 27101 0000202B 9D                      	popf
 27102 0000202C 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 27103 0000202E 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 27104 00002030 742D                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 27105                                  conferr:
 27106 00002032 BA[6045]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 27107 00002035 E87E24                  	call	badfil
 27108                                  ;endconv:	; 01/01/2023
 27109 00002038 C3                      	retn
 27110                                  
 27111                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27112                                  ;
 27113                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 27114                                  ;
 27115                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 27116                                  ;
 27117                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27118                                  
 27119                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27120                                  multi_pass:
 27121 00002039 0E                      	push	cs
 27122 0000203A 1F                      	pop	ds
 27123                                  
 27124 0000203B 803E[CD02]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 27125                                  ;jae_endconv:
 27126 00002040 731C                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 27127                                  
 27128                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27129 00002042 FF36[A302]              	push	word [CONFBOT]
 27130                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27131                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 27132 00002046 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 27133                                  
 27134 00002047 8B36[5803]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 27135 0000204B 8936[5603]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 27136 0000204F 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 27137 00002051 8936[5A03]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 27138 00002055 8936[AF02]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 27139                                  
 27140 00002059 E8E121                  	call	getchr
 27141 0000205C EB07                    	jmp	short conflp
 27142                                  
 27143                                  	; 01/01/2023
 27144                                  endconv:
 27145 0000205E C3                      	retn	
 27146                                  
 27147                                  getcom:
 27148                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27149                                  	; ds = cs
 27150 0000205F E81816                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 27151 00002062 E8D821                  	call	getchr
 27152                                  conflp: 
 27153 00002065 72F7                    	jc	short endconv
 27154                                  
 27155 00002067 FF06[AF02]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 27156                                  
 27157                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27158 0000206B 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 27159                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 27160                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 27161 0000206D 8826[C214]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0
 27162 00002071 8826[C514]              	mov	[setdevmarkflag],ah ; 0
 27163                                  
 27164 00002075 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 27165 00002077 7448                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 27166                                  
 27167                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27168                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 27169                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27170                                  ;%if 0
 27171                                  
 27172                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27173                                  
 27174                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 27175                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 27176                                  
 27177 00002079 A2[C014]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 27178                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 27179 0000207C 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 27180                                  
 27181                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27182 0000207E 3826[C114]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 27183                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 27184 00002082 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 27185                                  
 27186 00002084 50                              push    ax                      ;
 27187 00002085 E8B521                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27188 00002088 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27189 0000208A E8B021                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27190 0000208D 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 27191 0000208F A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 27192 00002092 58                              pop     ax
 27193                                  ;
 27194                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27195                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27196                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27197                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27198                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27199                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27200                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27201                                  ;   spot.
 27202                                  ;
 27203                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27204                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27205                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27206                                  ;   retrieved.
 27207                                  ;
 27208 00002093 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 27209 00002098 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27210                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27211 0000209A F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27212 0000209F 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 27213 000020A1 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 27214 000020A6 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27215                                  final:                                  ;
 27216 000020A8 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 27217                                  not_final:                              ;
 27218                                  ;endif
 27219                                  
 27220                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27221                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27222                                  
 27223 000020AB 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 27224 000020AD E88D21                  	call	getchr
 27225 000020B0 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 27226                                  
 27227 000020B2 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 27228                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 27229                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27230 000020B7 73A5                    	jnb	short endconv	
 27231 000020B9 E95608                  	jmp	badop
 27232                                  	
 27233                                  coff:	
 27234                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27235                                  	; ds = cs
 27236                                  	;push	cs
 27237                                  	;pop	ds
 27238 000020BC E87521                  	call	newline
 27239 000020BF EBA4                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 27240                                  
 27241                                  blank_line:
 27242 000020C1 E87921                  	call	getchr
 27243 000020C4 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 27244                                  
 27245                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27246                                  ; 11/12/2022
 27247                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 27248                                  ;coff_p:
 27249                                  	;push	cs
 27250                                  	;pop	ds
 27251                                  
 27252                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 27253                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 27254                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 27255                                  ;install= command.
 27256                                  
 27257                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27258                                  ;install command
 27259                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27260                                  
 27261                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27262                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 27263                                  tryi:
 27264 000020C6 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 27265 000020CB 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass

 27407                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27408                                  ;									      *
 27409                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27410                                  ;									      *
 27411                                  ; input :								      *
 27412                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27413                                  ; output:								      *
 27414                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27415                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27416                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27417                                  ;									      *
 27418                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27419                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27420                                  ; logic:								      *
 27421                                  ; {									      *
 27422                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27423                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27424                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27425                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27426                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27427                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27428                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27429                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27430                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27431                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27432                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27433                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27434                                  ;	};								      *
 27435                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27436                                  ; };									      *
 27437                                  ;									      *
 27438                                  ;******************************************************************************
