 27531                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27532                                  
 27533                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27534                                  ;									    *
 27535                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27536                                  ;									    *
 27537                                  ; input :								    *
 27538                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27539                                  ; output:								    *
 27540                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27541                                  ;									    *
 27542                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27543                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27544                                  ; logic:								    *
 27545                                  ; {									    *
 27546                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27547                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27548                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27549                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27550                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27551                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 27552                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 27553                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27554                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 27555                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 27556                                  ;	};								    *
 27557                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 27558                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 27559                                  ; };									    *
 27560                                  ;									    *
 27561                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27562

 27564                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)

 27566 000021C0 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 27567 000021C3 7539                    	jne	short trym
 27568                                  
 27569                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27570                                  ; (SYSINIT:2527h)
 27571                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27572                                  ;%if 0
 27573                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27574 000021C5 E8E21E                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27575 000021C8 7234                    	jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27576                                  ;endif
 27577                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27578                                  
 27579 000021CA BF[831D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 27580 000021CD 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27581                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27582                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27583                                  do22:
 27584 000021CF E82107                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27585 000021D2 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 27586                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 27587                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 27588                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27589                                  ;sr22:
 27590                                  	;jmp	coff
 27591                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27592 000021D4 E94B06                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27593                                  if22:
 27594 000021D7 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 27595 000021DA 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 27596                                  
 27597                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 27598 000021DC 803E[7C1D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 27599 000021E1 7507                    	jne	short if26
 27600

 28201                                  skip_pass_limit:
 28202                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 28203                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 28204                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 28205                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 28206                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 28207                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
 28208                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.

 29143                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29144                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29145                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29146                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29147                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29148                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29149                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29150                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29151                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29152                                  
 29153                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29154                                  ;									  *
 29155                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29156                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29157                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29158                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29159                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29160                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29161                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29162                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29163                                  ; input :								  *
 29164                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29165                                  ; output:								  *
 29166                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29167                                  ;									  *
 29168                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29169                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29170                                  ; logic:								  *
 29171                                  ; {									  *
 29172                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29173                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29174                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29175                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29176                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29177                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29178                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29179                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29180                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29181                                  ;	     }								  *
 29182                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29183                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29184                                  ;	};								  *
 29185                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29186                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29187                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29188                                  ; };									  *
 29189                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29190                                  
 29191                                  tryk:
 29192                                          ;if      stacksw
 29193

 29534                                  ;************************************************************************
 29535                                  ; function: parse the parameters of fcbs= command.			*
 29536                                  ;									*
 29537                                  ; input :								*
 29538                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				*
 29539                                  ; output:								*
 29540                                  ;	set the variables fcbs,keep.					*

 29544                                  ; logic:								*
 29545                                  ; {									*
 29546                                  ;	set di points to fcbs_parms;					*

 29549                                  ;	{ sysparse;							*
 29550                                  ;	  if (no error) then						*
 29551                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = fcbs */		*
 29552                                  ;		   fcbs = result_val._$P_picked_val;			*
 29553                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = keep */ 	*

 29665                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29666                                  ;								       *
 29667                                  ; function: parse the option switches specified.		       *
 29668                                  ; note - this command is intended for the future use also.	       *
 29669                                  ; when we need to set system data flag,use this command.	       *
 29670                                  ;								       *
 29671                                  ; input :							       *
 29672                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.			       *
 29673                                  ; output:							       *
 29674                                  ;	p_swit_k set if /k option chosen.			       *
 29675                                  ;								       *
 29676                                  ; subroutines to be called:					       *
 29677                                  ;	sysinit_parse						       *
 29678                                  ; logic:							       *
 29679                                  ; {								       *
 29680                                  ;	set di points to swit_parms;  /*parse control definition*/     *
 29681                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 					       *
 29682                                  ;	while (end of command line)				       *
 29683                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;					       *
 29684                                  ;	  if (no error) then					       *
 29685                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == swit_k) then	       *
 29686                                  ;		    p_swit_k = 1				       *
 29687                                  ;	       endif						       *
 29688                                  ;	  else {show error message;error exit}			       *
 29689                                  ;	};							       *
 29690                                  ; };								       *

 29934                                  sysinit_parse:
 29935                                  
 29936                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29937                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 29938                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 29939                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 29940                                  ;
 29941                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 29942                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 29943                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29944                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29945                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29946                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29947                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29948                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29949                                  ;	 procedure.
 29950                                  ;	ax - exit code
 29951                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 29952                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 29953                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 29954                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 29955                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30299                                  ;
 30300                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30301                                  ;
 30302                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30303                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30304                                  ;
 30305                                  ;	Output : none
 30306                                  ;
 30307                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30308                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30309                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30310                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30311                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30312                                  ;
 30313                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30314                                  
 30315                                  LieInt12Mem:
 30316                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30317                                  	; ds = cs

 30320                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30321 0000299B E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30322 0000299E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30323                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30324                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30325                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30326                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 30327                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30328                                  	; ds = cs
 30329 000029A0 803E[871F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 30330 000029A5 74F0                    	je	short limx
 30331 000029A7 A1[6D1F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 30332                                  lim_set:
 30333                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30334                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30335                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 30336                                  ;limx:
 30337                                  	;retn
 30338                                  	
 30339                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem

 30341                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30342                                  ;
 30343                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30344                                  ;
 30345                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30346                                  ;	Output : none
 30347                                  ;
 30348                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30349                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30350                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30351                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30352                                  ;
 30353                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30354                                  
 30355                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30356                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30357 000029AA 1E                      	push	ds
 30358 000029AB BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30359 000029AE 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30360 000029B0 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30361 000029B4 2E891E[8B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30362 000029B9 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30363 000029BB D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30364 000029BD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30365 000029C0 2EC606[8A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30366 000029C6 1F                      	pop	ds
 30367                                  ;limx:
 30368 000029C7 C3                      	retn
 30369                                  
 30370                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30371                                  ;
 30372                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30373                                  ;
 30374                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30375                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30376                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30377                                  ;
 30378                                  ;	Output : none
 30379                                  ;
 30380                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 30381                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30382                                  ;
 30383                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30384                                  
 30385                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 30386                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30387                                  	; ds = cs
 30388 000029C8 803E[8A1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30389                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 30390                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30391                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30392 000029CD 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30393                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30394 000029CF B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30395 000029D2 8826[8A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30396                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30397                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30398 000029D6 1E                      	push	ds
 30399                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30400 000029D7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30401 000029D9 2EA1[8B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 30402 000029DD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 30403 000029E0 1F                      	pop	ds
 30404                                  timx:
 30405 000029E1 C3                      	retn

 30458                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 30460                                  
 30461                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30462                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30463                                  
 30464                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30465                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30466                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30467                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30468                                  
 30469                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30470                                  ;
 30471                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30472                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30473                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30474                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30475                                  ;
 30476                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30477                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30478                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30479                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30480                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30481                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30482                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30483                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30484                                  ; available during the load.
 30485                                  ;
 30486                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30487                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30488                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30489                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30490                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30491                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30492                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30493                                  ;
 30494                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30495                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30496                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30497                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30498                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30499                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30500                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30501                                  ;
 30502                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30503                                  
 30504                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30505                                  
 30506                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30507                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30508                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30509                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30510                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30511                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30512                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30513                                  
 30514                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30515                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30516                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30517                                  
 30518                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30519                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30520                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30521                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30522                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30523                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30524                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30525                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30526                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30527                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30528                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30529                                  
 30530                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30531                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30532                                  
 30533                                  InitVar:
 30534                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30535                                  	; ds = cs
 30536                                  
 30537                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30538                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30539                                  	;push	ax
 30540                                  	;push	cx
 30541                                  	;push	di
 30542 00002A0C 06                      	push	es
 30543                                  
 30544                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30545 00002A0D 0E                      	push	cs
 30546 00002A0E 07                      	pop	es
 30547                                  
 30548 00002A0F 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30549                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30550                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30551                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30552                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30553                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30554                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30555                                  
 30556                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30557                                  	; ds = cs
 30558 00002A11 A2[321F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30559 00002A14 A2[311F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30560 00002A17 A3[331F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30561 00002A1A C606[351F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30562                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30563 00002A1F A2[681F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30564                                  
 30565 00002A22 FC                      	cld
 30566                                  
 30567 00002A23 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30568 00002A26 BF[361F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30569 00002A29 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30570                                  
 30571                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30572                                  	; 01/01/2033
 30573 00002A2B B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 30574 00002A2D BF[461F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30575 00002A30 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30576                                  
 30577                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30578                                  
 30579                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30580 00002A32 07                      	pop	es
 30581                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30582                                  	;pop	di
 30583                                  	;pop	cx
 30584                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30585                                  
 30586 00002A33 C3                      	retn
 30587                                  
 30588                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30589                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30590                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30591                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30592                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30593                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30594                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30595                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30596                                  
 30597                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30598                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30599                                  FixMem:
 30600                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30601                                  	;push	ax
 30602                                  	;push	bx
 30603                                  	;push	cx
 30604                                  	;push	dx
 30605 00002A34 06                      	push	es
 30606                                  
 30607 00002A35 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30608                                  
 30609 00002A38 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30610 00002A3B 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30611                                  
 30612 00002A3D 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30613                                  
 30614                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30615                                  
 30616 00002A3F 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30617 00002A41 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30618 00002A43 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30619                                  
 30620                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30621                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30622                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30623                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30624                                  
 30625 00002A44 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30626 00002A48 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30627 00002A4D 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30628 00002A4F 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30629                                  
 30630                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30631                                  
 30632 00002A51 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30633 00002A56 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30634 00002A58 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30635                                  
 30636 00002A5C 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30637                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30638                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30639 00002A61 43                      	inc	bx
 30640 00002A62 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30641                                  
 30642                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30643                                  
 30644 00002A67 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30645 00002A69 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30646                                  
 30647 00002A6E 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30648 00002A70 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30649 00002A75 43                      	inc	bx
 30650 00002A76 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30651                                  
 30652                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30653 00002A78 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30654 00002A7A 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30655                                  fmX:	
 30656 00002A7C E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30657                                  
 30658 00002A7F 07                      	pop	es
 30659                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30660                                  	;pop	dx
 30661                                  	;pop	cx
 30662                                  	;pop	bx
 30663                                  	;pop	ax
 30664                                  
 30665 00002A80 C3                      	retn

 30731                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30732                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30733                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30734                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30735                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30736                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30737                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30738                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30739                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30740                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30741                                  ;
 30742                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30743                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30744                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30745                                  ;
 30746                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30747                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30748                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30749                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30750                                  ;
 30751                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30752                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30753                                  ;
 30754                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30755                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30756                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30757                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30758                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30759                                  ;     lh
 30760                                  ;     /l
 30761                                  ;     1
 30762                                  ;     1000
 30763                                  ;     2
 30764                                  ;     print
 30765                                  ;     /d
 30766                                  ;     :lpt2
 30767                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30768                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30769                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30770                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30771                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30772                                  ; for:
 30773                                  ;    Each /L
 30774                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30775                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30776                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30777                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30778                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30779                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30780                                  
 30781                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30782                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30783                                  
 30784                                  ParseVar:
 30785                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30786                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30787                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30788 00002A9E 1E                      	push	ds
 30789 00002A9F 06                      	push	es
 30790                                  
 30791 00002AA0 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30792 00002AA1 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30793 00002AA2 FC                      	cld
 30794                                  
 30795                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30796                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30797                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30798                                  
 30799 00002AA3 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30800 00002AA4 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 30801 00002AA7 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30802                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30803 00002AA9 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30804 00002AAB 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30805                                  
 30806 00002AAD 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30807 00002AAE F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30808 00002AAF EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30809                                  
 30810 00002AB1 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30811                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30812 00002AB2 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 30813                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30814 00002AB4 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30815 00002AB6 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 30816                                  
 30817                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30818 00002AB8 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30819                                  
 30820                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30821                                  	;
 30822                                  	;push	es
 30823                                  	;push	cs
 30824                                  	;pop	es
 30825                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30826                                  	;pop	es
 30827                                  
 30828 00002ABD 2EC606[321F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30829                                  
 30830 00002AC3 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30831                                  
 30832                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30833 00002AC5 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 30834 00002AC7 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 30835                                  
 30836                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30837 00002AC9 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30838                                  
 30839 00002ACE E80E00                  	call	parseL
 30840 00002AD1 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30841                                  
 30842 00002AD3 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30843 00002AD4 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30844                                  
 30845                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30846 00002AD6 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30847 00002AD9 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 30848 00002ADA 4E                      	dec	si
 30849 00002ADB F9                      	stc
 30850                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30851 00002ADC 07                      	pop	es
 30852 00002ADD 1F                      	pop	ds
 30853                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30854                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30855 00002ADE C3                      	retn
 30856                                  
 30857                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30858                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30859                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30860                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30861                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30862                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30863                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30864                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30865                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30866                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30867                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 30868                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30869                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30870                                  
 30871                                  parseL:
 30872 00002ADF AC                      	lodsb
 30873 00002AE0 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30874 00002AE2 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30875                                  
 30876                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30877                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30878                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30879                                  
 30880 00002AE4 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30881 00002AE7 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30882 00002AE9 E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30883                                  
 30884 00002AEC 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30885 00002AEE E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30886 00002AF1 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30887                                  
 30888                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30889 00002AF3 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30890                                  
 30891 00002AF8 AC                      	lodsb
 30892 00002AF9 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30893 00002AFB 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30894                                  
 30895 00002AFD E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30896 00002B00 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30897                                  
 30898 00002B02 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30899 00002B05 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30900                                  
 30901                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30902 00002B07 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30903 00002B09 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30904                                  
 30905 00002B0B 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30906 00002B0D 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30907                                  
 30908                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30909                                  
 30910 00002B0F E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30911 00002B12 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30912                                  
 30913 00002B14 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30914                                  
 30915 00002B17 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30916                                  
 30917                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30918 00002B1A 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30919                                  
 30920 00002B1F AC                      	lodsb
 30921 00002B20 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30922 00002B22 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 30923                                  
 30924 00002B24 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 30925 00002B27 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 30926                                  
 30927 00002B29 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 30928 00002B2C 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30929                                  
 30930                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30931 00002B2E 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 30932 00002B30 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 30933                                  plE1:	
 30934                                  	;mov	ax,1
 30935 00002B32 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 30936 00002B35 4E                      	dec	si
 30937 00002B36 F9                      	stc
 30938 00002B37 C3                      	retn
 30939                                  
 30940                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 30941 00002B38 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 30942                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30943                                  	; cf=1
 30944                                  	;stc
 30945 00002B3B C3                      	retn
 30946                                  plSwX:	
 30947 00002B3C 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 30948                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 30949                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 30950                                  	; cf=0
 30951                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 30952 00002B3D C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 30953                                  
 30954                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30955                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 30956                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30979                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30980                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30981                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30982                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30983                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30984                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30985                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30986                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30987                                  
 30988                                  isEOL:
 30989 00002B3E 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 30990 00002B40 7406                    	je	short ieX
 30991 00002B42 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 30992 00002B44 7402                    	je	short ieX
 30993 00002B46 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 30994                                  ieX:	
 30995 00002B48 C3                      	retn
 30996                                  
 30997                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30998                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 30999                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31000                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31001                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31002                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31003                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31004                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31005                                  
 31006                                  isWhite:
 31007 00002B49 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 31008 00002B4B 7406                    	je	short iwX
 31009 00002B4D 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 31010 00002B4F 7402                    	je	short iwX
 31011 00002B51 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 31012                                  iwX:	
 31013 00002B53 C3                      	retn
 31014

 31066                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31067                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31068                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31069                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31070                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31071                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31072                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31073                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31074                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31075                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31076                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31077                                  
 31078                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31079                                  stowUMB:
 31080 00002B67 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31081 00002B69 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31082 00002B6B F9                      	stc
 31083 00002B6C C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 31084                                  su10:	
 31085                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31086                                  	;push	bx
 31087                                  	;push	di
 31088                                  	;push	si
 31089                                  	;push	ds
 31090                                  	;push	es
 31091                                  	;push	cs
 31092                                  	;pop	es
 31093                                  	;push	cs
 31094                                  	;pop	ds
 31095                                  
 31096                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31097                                  	; ds <> cs
 31098                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31099 00002B6D 2E803E[351F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31100                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31101 00002B73 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31102 00002B75 2EA2[351F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31103                                  
 31104                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31105                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31106                                  	;jne	short su20
 31107                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31108                                  su20:	
 31109 00002B79 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 31110 00002B7B 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 31111                                  
 31112                                  	;mov	bl,al
 31113                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 31114                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 31115                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31116 00002B7D 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 31117 00002B7F 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 31118 00002B81 B001                    	mov	al,1
 31119                                  
 31120                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31121                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31122 00002B83 2E8687[361F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31123                                  
 31124                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 31125                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 31126                                  	;
 31127                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 31128                                  	
 31129                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31130 00002B88 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 31131 00002B8A F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 31132                                  su30:	
 31133                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31134                                  	;pop	es
 31135                                  	;pop	ds
 31136                                  	;pop	si
 31137                                  	;pop	di
 31138                                  	;pop	bx
 31139 00002B8B C3                      	retn
 31140                                  
 31141                                  ; 08/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 31142                                  %if 0
 31143                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31144                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 31145                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31146                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 31147                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31148                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31149                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31150                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31151                                  
 31152                                  ; 13/05/2019
 31153                                  
 31154                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31155                                  stowSiz:
 31156                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31157                                  	;push	bx
 31158                                  	;;push	di ; ?
 31159                                  	;push	es
 31160                                  
 31161                                  	;push	cs
 31162                                  	;pop	es	
 31163                                  
 31164                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 31165                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 31166                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 31167                                  	;mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 31168                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31169                                  	mov	[cs:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 31170                                  
 31171                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31172                                  	;pop	es
 31173                                  	;;pop	di ; ?
 31174                                  	;pop	bx
 31175                                  
 31176                                  	retn
 31177                                  %endif
 31178                                  
 31179                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31180                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 31181                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 31182                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 31183                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 31184                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31185                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 31186                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 31187                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 31188                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 31189                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31190                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31191                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31192                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31193                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31194                                  
 31195                                  gnradix:
 31196 00002B8C 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 31197                                  
 31198                                  toDigit:
 31199 00002B8E 2E833E[8C2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31200 00002B94 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 31201                                  
 31202                                  toDigit_hex:
 31203 00002B96 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 31204 00002B99 7209                    	jb	short td10
 31205 00002B9B 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 31206 00002B9E 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 31207 00002BA0 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 31208                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31209 00002BA3 C3                      	retn
 31210                                  td10:	
 31211 00002BA4 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 31212 00002BA7 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 31213 00002BA9 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 31214 00002BAC 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 31215 00002BAE 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 31216                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31217 00002BB1 C3                      	retn
 31218                                  toDigit_dec:
 31219                                  td20:	
 31220 00002BB2 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 31221                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 31222 00002BB5 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 31223 00002BB7 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 31224 00002BBA 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 31225 00002BBC 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 31226                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31227 00002BBF C3                      	retn
 31228                                  tdE:	
 31229 00002BC0 F9                      	stc
 31230                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 31231 00002BC1 C3                      	retn
 31232                                  
 31233                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31234                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 31235                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31236                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 31237                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 31238                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 31239                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 31240                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31241                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31242                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31243                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31244                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31245                                  
 31246                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31247                                  
 31248                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31249                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 31250                                  
 31251                                  GetXNum:
 31252                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 31253                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31254                                  	;push	bx
 31255 00002BC2 51                      	push	cx ; *
 31256                                  	;push	ds
 31257                                  
 31258 00002BC3 FC                      	cld
 31259 00002BC4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31260 00002BC6 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31261 00002BC8 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 31262 00002BCA 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 31263                                  
 31264 00002BCC 2EC706[8C2B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 31265                                  
 31266 00002BD3 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 31267                                  	;call	toDigit
 31268 00002BD6 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 31269                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 31270                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31271 00002BD9 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 31272                                  
 31273 00002BDB 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 31274 00002BDD 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 31275 00002BDF 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 31276 00002BE3 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 31277 00002BE6 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 31278 00002BE8 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 31279 00002BEB 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 31280                                  
 31281                                  gxn10:	
 31282 00002BED 2EC706[8C2B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 31283 00002BF4 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 31284 00002BF5 46                      	inc	si
 31285                                  
 31286                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31287                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 31288                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 31289                                  ;        BX    = 0
 31290                                  ;        CH    = 0
 31291                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31292                                  
 31293                                  gxn20:	
 31294 00002BF6 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 31295 00002BF9 46                      	inc	si
 31296                                  
 31297 00002BFA E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 31298 00002BFD 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 31299                                  
 31300 00002BFF E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 31301 00002C02 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 31302                                  
 31303 00002C04 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 31304 00002C06 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 31305                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 31306                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 31307 00002C08 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 31308                                  gxnE:	
 31309                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 31310 00002C0A EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 31311                                  gxnQ:	
 31312 00002C0C 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 31313 00002C0D F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 31314                                  gxnX:	
 31315                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31316                                  	;pop	ds
 31317 00002C0E 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 31318                                  	;pop	bx
 31319 00002C0F C3                      	retn
 31320                                  
 31321                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31322                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 31323                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31324                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 31325                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 31326                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 31327                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31328                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31329                                  
 31330                                  mul32:
 31331 00002C10 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31332 00002C11 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31333 00002C13 2EF726[8C2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31334 00002C18 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 31335                                  
 31336 00002C1A 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31337 00002C1C 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31338                                  
 31339 00002C1D 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31340 00002C1F 2EF726[8C2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31341 00002C24 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31342 00002C26 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31343 00002C28 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31344 00002C2A C3                      	retn
 31345                                  m32E:	
 31346 00002C2B 58                      	pop	ax
 31347 00002C2C C3                      	retn
 31348                                  
 31349                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31350                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 31351                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31352                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 31353                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 31354                                  ; ERROR:   None
 31355                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31356                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31357                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 31358                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 31359                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31360                                  
 31361                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31362                                  toPara:
 31363 00002C2D 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 31364                                  
 31365 00002C2E B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 31366 00002C30 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 31367 00002C32 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 31368 00002C33 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 31369 00002C35 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 31370 00002C37 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 31371                                  
 31372 00002C39 59                      	pop	cx
 31373 00002C3A C3                      	retn
